b'I just had the worst experience with Chili\'s Grill & Bar. My coworker called in my lunch order of the mix and match fajitas which I have ordered before online for $10.99 and they came with soup and rice. Today I was told that it doesn\'t come with soup or rice and when she went to pick it up she was charged $16.39. When I called, a girl named Iessa told me that because my coworker didn\'t specifically say "$10.99 mix and match fajitas" and she just said "mix and match fajitas" I was charged $16.39. So how is it that you get less food for more money??!! Sorry Chili\'s, I love your food, but don\'t know if I\'ll be back....'

b"We live in a world where consumers are starting to question how the products that they use come to be and more and more people every day are choosing compassion instead of cruelty.

Will you let your business fall behind the mark by not guaranteeing the protection against animal cruelty of the animals that you use?

I was shocked and saddened to learn about the treatment of chickens in the Chili's food chain. I hope and pray that Chilis will make a change for the better in the immediate future."

b"Chilli's please get with the times and offer vegan options on your menu!"

b'I wanted to send out a special thank you to all the crew, especially Brianna (Server) and Justin (Cook or Manager?) of your Clarksville, Wilma Rudolph location.

I have been under the weather for over a week and really wanted a nice evening out.  I decide on having a meal with my friend and her daughter.  And I am overjoyed to have paid over forty-four dollars for them to have a nice meal.

Myself on the other hand, food and service was sub-par at best.

Fried pickles had more oil floating on them, then the Gulf of Mexico.  These appetizer were served with a pool of dirty grease at the bottom of the dish, enough to soak through the fancy paper served with them.

And there was the same dirty oil splashed all over the plate and the outside of the server container.

If the pickles weren't bad or old enough, the cracklin they tossed in for good measure was hard and I bet just as chewy, as the gum stuck under the table.

Then the buffalo chicken sandwich I ordered arrived and was sent straight back to the kitchen.  My friend is sitting there with a fresh rack of ribs and her daughter has a fresh burger with a properly cooked egg on it.  

Me?

I get a piece of roadkill, that was dark, pasty, dried out and had more age on it, then Betty White.  

Most times, when I see such lack of respect for food and customers, I get up and leave.  I can't trust a cook who can't respect food, not to sabotage a refire.

But I was desperate to have a nice evening and stupid me, I sent it back.  

Round two with the now, seriously dead bird, looked great when Brianna brought it back out.  Until closer inspection.  So, what they did, is take an old one, re-breaded it, re-fried it, re-coated it and brought that out to me.

Those french fries coming out exactly 4 minutes after my second dead bird, makes me suspect, they used the same fryer to cook the chicken and the potatoes.  That is a big health no no.

So I wouldn't recommend any of your staff for any sort of cooking competition were the stakes are no higher then achieving a negative rating.

I say your staff, because I had to think about how uncaring Justin was, when he came out and asked what was wrong and said he would fix my bill.  He never said what his title was.  For all I know, he was the toilet cleaner sent out to blow smoke up my knickers.

But I also had to think of the cold uncaring attitude I got from Brianna.  Starting from when we first arrived and she used the incorrect pronouns and called me, "Sir"

Of course I corrected her right away, but I don't think it helped.  Because shortly afterwards, she had the hostess follow me into the restroom and supervise me.

With me being a big woman, middle age with a hormone imbalance, she evidently decided her agendas, superseded human decency.  And your staff supported her like a Sunday morning choir.

Well hallelujah and can I get an amen!

 Thanks Justin taking my meal off, so could just I pay to watch my friends eat a decent, nearly fresh meal.

Now I only feel discriminated against. hungry, pissed off and angry. 

There is too much hate in this world, for it to continue.  Especially on nights when we are just looking to disconnect from all the negativity.

So, once more Chili's of Clarksville, thanks a heap for the lousy service, the lousy dog food you sent me, thanks for the chipped tooth and thanks for perpetuating the demise of the human race.  With your food and your hatred. 

Cordially;

Ms Ruth Cutler'

b"UPDATE: \nMy family went to Chili's December 31st for dinner. Even though there were a lot of empty tables, we were told that it would be 10-15 minutes because they were getting servers back on track??? We ended up waiting closer to 30 minutes and were about to leave since we had two four year olds who needed to eat, but then they seated us. It took another 10 minutes to get anyone to even take drink orders. One of my twins wanted a pepperoni pizza kids meal and the other wanted cheese. Another 10 minutes after ordering, the waiter came over and said that they didn't have any cheese pizza. So after some convincing my daughter, we ordered another pepperoni pizza. Over 20 minutes later, we finally got our food. My tacos were COLD. Everything on my plate was cold. I told the waiter and he said they could heat it back up. My husband had order crispy chicken crispers and got regular and wanted regular corn on the cob and they brought street corn. And they only brought one kids meal. After tracking down our waiter, the person who brought us our food came to our table with him and he said that they were also out of pepperoni pizzas. Didn't bother to bring her side or anything. Again, she's FOUR and we've been there for over an hour at this point. He said mac n cheese was the quickest if we wanted her to get food quickly, so we ordered that. After awhile, he finally brought that out but still forgot her side of broccoli... finally got it and it was cold also. He brought my tacos back out and the beans were still cold, even though I had told him twice that it wasn't just the tacos but that it all was cold. My husband got the correct corn and then we had to remind him again about the chicken being wrong. Eventually, we all got our food. We had to ask several times for more water, napkins, and silverware. Then once we got the ticket, we were charged for three kids meals. I had taken the kids to the bathroom while my husband paid and he didn't notice since we were in a hurry to get them home for bedtime. I brought the receipt by the next day and asked to speak to a manager. She was nice, but never once apologized. I gave her the receipt and explained everything and she said it would be taken care of in a few days since it was New Years and corporate was closed. She called me a couple days later and needed more info to find the ticket. I gave her the ticket number and server, date, total, what we ordered... After several phone calls, she said she had the info she needed and would fax it in and again it would take a few days for the refund to show up. It's been two weeks now and nothing has shown up. This is ridiculous. All we were asking for is to not be charged for a third kids meal that we never got. Honestly, the whole ticket should have been comped since there were SO MANY errors and the entire experience was awful, but again, we just asked to not be charged for a meal we never ordered or received. We used to love Chili's but the last several times we've been it has gotten worse and worse. I've lost all patience with the Hot Springs, AR location. If I don't see a full refund by Monday, I'm disputing the charge with my bank to get it handled that way."
b'Thank you for your invitation for dad daughter meal, but was not impressed with the service or the food or the cleanliness'

b"Dear Chili's: I am a resident of the Portland Metro area. Many years ago, we had a Chili's located at one of our local malls, Clackamas Town Center. One day, I went to go enjoy a delicious meal there, and came upon the horrific realization that it was no longer there. Yes, tragically, the ONE Chili's we had was in fact shut down. I have done some research, and I noticed that Sacramento, CA alone has three locations (I was blessed enough to be able to visit one of those locations recently). Okinawa, Japan has at least one location (on an army base) and Guam, which is located in the middle of Oceania, has a location. I would love to get some information regarding the closing of the Portland, OR location, and am wondering if there is anyone I can speak to about getting a new location in the Portland Metro area. I know it would be highly successful, due to the shocking continuing success of Applebee's. Please take my concerns into consideration and understand that this is something that has been deeply upsetting for the past few years, not just to me, but to my family members and others in the community. Thank you for your time and I look forward to hearing from you."
b'I really want to come eat at your establishment but neither of the two local restaurants participate in the chilis + plenty rewards. :('

b'The location in Lawrenceville Ga has gone to complete garbage. Fix it or shut it down. Cold food, flat beer and a horrible selection on draft. Same beers from 3 years ago....no lie. Update or continue to lose business.'

After several phone calls, she said she had the info she needed and would fax it in and again it would take a few days for the refund to show up. It's been two weeks now and nothing has shown up. This is ridiculous. All we were asking for is to not be charged for a third kids meal that we never got. Honestly, the whole ticket should have been comped since there were SO MANY errors and the entire experience was awful, but again, we just asked to not be charged for a meal we never ordered or received. We used to love Chili's but the last several times we've been it has gotten worse and worse. I've lost all patience with the Hot Springs, AR location. If I don't see a full refund by Monday, I'm disputing the charge with my bank to get it handled that way."

My sister found plastic in her ribs today. JJ immediately resolved the situation. Brought out a fresh order of ribs.  We went to pay the bill and he informed us that he picked up the bill, which I repeatedly tried to pay. He apologized but we explained to him we just wanted him to be aware of the plastic and that we still love the food there. Since he was kind enough to pick up the tab I left the waitress a $20 tip because I had every intention of paying full price for the meal. All in all, I think JJ is an exemplary manager and should be recognized for outstanding service!!'

b"Really Chilli's?! Now you want my cellphone number just to be seated? Who's idiot idea was this? Do you realize how much of a clusterf*ck the hostess area is because of this?  Just give a pager like any normal restaurant and get on with it! Besides, you don't need my number so you can bombard it with unwanted spam texts - and don't pretend like that isn't your end game. And you wonder why people arent going to restaurants like yours anymore..."
b'Back in 1984, we rolled out a menu card showing Guests the right way to eat fajitas. Fork and knife not required.'

b'I wanted to share an experience I had with your Windsor, CT location.  My husband and I went in for dinner on 1/3/18, I ordered the fiery peppered crispers.  When they arrived they were not fully coated but heavily draped in the sauce, I took one bite and knew I couldn\'t eat it, it was just overwhelming.  My waiter came by I told him and I asked for the honey chipolte instead, he obliged.  The manager, Corrine came by to apologize to which I responded no need to do so because it was a taste issue, but I was impressed that she came by and did that.  I got my new crispers and because I started with a salad and ate most of my side before the crispers came I ended up not eating most of them due to being full.  I asked for a box, we boxed up mine along with my husband\'s leftovers.  We paid the bill, walked to the car and I realized I had forgotten my box of food, my husband went back in.  The table had been cleared he approached the host, he was stand offish and then said he "thinks" it got thrown out and he could make it again.  My husband returned to the car without the food and rather than waiting because it was getting late, I left and called Corrine.  She remembered me from the original situation with the crispers and felt bad.  She offered to reimburse me for my meal with gift cards, I thought this was acceptable.  I wanted to share my experience as a great one, but I do have one complaint.  Maybe rather than complaint a suggestion for better outcomes in the future.  Approximately 1 minute to a maximum of 2 had passed before my husband went to retrieve the food.  Rather than lose inventory twice from my taste buds, to the throw away and offer to remake it and now a third time from free inventory with the gift cards staff should not throw away leftovers that quickly.  At the very minimum a 5 minute hold or how about walk outside and TRY to look for the customer?  I\'m really disappointed that all that food went to waste because someone was too "quick" to assume nobody was coming back.  I can\'t even say the person was lazy because it was turned over so fast.  I also ended up leaving my server a $10 tip to say a big thanks for taking care of me and then I was furious that this happened, as I drove home I told my husband it was obviously not our server that cleared the table because he would have made the effort to get the food to us because of what had occurred.  So a long winded compliment with a back end suggestion.  Thanks for listening!'

b"I had to admit - I wasn't expecting to find much on your menu that I could eat (due to liver concerns).... but the black bean fajita was incredible! It was flavorful with great seasoning and such a huge portion that I had enough for another full meal. Thank you for providing a great choice for those of us who cannot ingest meat (for medical or ethical reasons). And my server was wonderful and listened to my concerns - going above and beyond to make sure there was no shredded cheese (in case of the natural mold inhibitor natamycin). I haven't been to the Victor/Rochester Chili's in years but now I have a good reason.Please keep this on your menu!"

b'At Chili\xe2\x80\x99s, we believe everyone should be themselves. And we know that starts with us.

Thanks to your support, we\xe2\x80\x99ve had the pleasure of learning and growing every day for the past forty two years. We started life in 1975 as a small burger shack on Greenville Avenue in Dallas, and now we serve burgers, ribs and fajitas all around the world. As we\xe2\x80\x99ve grown, our menu has grown, until we ended up with 125 dishes\xe2\x80\x94about as many college football teams as there are in the NCAA. You could get everything from quinoa to mango tilapia at the favorite Chili\xe2\x80\x99s down the street, but we heard you ask us a question: \xe2\x80\x9cJust because you can be everything to all does that mean that you should?\xe2\x80\x9d So, after a lot of self-reflection, we\xe2\x80\x99ve realized something you may already know \xe2\x80\x94 in restaurants as in life, you just can\xe2\x80\x99t be everything to everyone.  We\xe2\x80\x99re making a dramatic change, and we wanted you to know first.

Sounds like we might be closing our doors, doesn\xe2\x80\x99t it?  Oh no no no no no.  If anything, we\xe2\x80\x99re kicking them down. We\xe2\x80\x99re cutting our menu by 40% so we can increase the quality and size of what we\xe2\x80\x99ve always done best: our burgers, ribs, fajitas. The roots that really make us, us.  We know you might miss one of your favorites, but we hope you\xe2\x80\x99ll give us a chance to show we can bring you the very best food, every time you visit. The kind of \xe2\x80\x9cDang, that was good\xe2\x80\x9d food you received on your first Chili\xe2\x80\x99s visit years ago.

The new menu launches on September 18th. We\xe2\x80\x99ll see you there, and we\xe2\x80\x99ll come as we are. You should too. Welcome back.'

Here's a letter from our President that explains more. #Chilislove \n\nhttp://brinker.mediaroom.com/HurricaneHarvey"

b"I just had a really bad experience at the Chili's location in the Columbus, Ohio airport.  I arrived at the host stand and was not greeted for 10 minutes.  Not only was I not greeted, I was not even acknowledged by a staff member in that time.  In fact, the bartender went so far as to purposefully ignore me when I waved at him to try to get his attention to notify a hostess that myself and 4 other guests were waiting for tables.  Then, after being seated, I was not served for 15 minutes.  The part that I did not understand is that this location was very slow at the time.  There were very few tables with patrons.  I ordered the Margarita Grilled Chicken and decided to have a side full order of shrimp because I like shrimp.  When the food came another 20 minutes later, I received 4 shrimp for a full order, each of which were the size of my thumbnail, and for the tiny shrimp the order said I would be charged 7.95.  To me, a total time to get my food of 45 minutes at a slow location, plus being overcharged for tiny (and less than advertised) shrimp is completely unacceptable."

b"Sad to say but the Chili's Pleasanton TX location was absolutely horrible. My family and I walked out on all this. My daughter had the smokehouse combo. Ribs were not hot or tender. My husband had the tacos. The tortillas were dried and hard and the meat wasn't hot. I had the sirloin steak made to be cooked medium well and it was well done. My mashed potatoes were cold and the cream gravy was gelatinous. My asparagus was also cool to the touch. Absolutely dissatisfied with our meal. Very much a let down after pulling a long shift at work and wanting a hot meal. Took us over an hour and a half to even get our meal."

b"Dear Chili's - you were my utmost favorite restaurant for 24 years after moving down to Oklahoma from Canada so many years back.  At the age of 17, I was introduced to my first ever Chicken Fried Steak and white gravy.  My life was changed. 

I provided you with more free advertising and referrals than I can remember.

Sadly, you have taken your absolute best item off the menu, and the local restaurants that want to try and accommodate don't even have the supplies to do so...

Until my beloved Chicken Fried Steak, seasoned mashed potatoes, (with delicious chunks of potato skin), juicy corn on the cob, and delicious white gravy return to the menu, I am afraid we will not be returning with our family of six.

Please reconsider and put that wonderful item back on the menu for all to enjoy!   Thanks."

b"We pause for Memorial Day with Family, Friends and members of the US Armed Forces known as our Warfighter's. We will break bread with Burgers. Ribs. Fajitas. It all started with a dream: to create a place you\xe2\x80\x99d want to go and hang out with good friends over a burger and a beer. For people who craved connection with family and friends, we were the only ones to offer a genuine Southwest spirit filled with positive energy. Since then, we\xe2\x80\x99ve boldly claimed our place in the restaurant universe. Today, you can find us in 32 different countries. We happily celebrated 20 years in Mexico and we\xe2\x80\x99re excited to be opening new locations in Asia and beyond. People around the globe love our Fresh Tex and Fresh Mex flavors, and the fun ways that we make every Guest feel special."

b"Chili's Management, I'm not happy.  Please help:

I placed a To-Go order at your Danbury, CT location on 5/16/17 and promptly picked it up at 10:21pm.  I ordered the Southwestern Egg Rolls and Triple Berry Cake.  

I realize that most menu items received rarely look exactly like the ones pictured on the menu, but, I do expect to receive ALL of, and ENOUGH of, the same ingredients as if I had sat down in your restaurant and placed an order.

Now, this is the SECOND TIME this has happened; previous incident was about two months ago.  I didn't complain the first time because I thought it was a fluke; now I believe that this is standard operating procedure for To-Go orders:  'Rip-off the customer'.

In the attached picture, the top pics show what is on your website, the bottom pics show what I received.  Again, I realize that what I receive will never look as pretty as it does on the menu/website, but hear me out:

Southwestern Egg Rolls: I've had these dozens of times over the years in your restaurants and each time they have been CUT IN HALF and served on a bed of SHREDDED LETTUCE.  I received three uncut egg rolls with no lettuce....naked egg rolls.   (2nd time on a to-go order).

Triple Berry Cake: I've also had this several times in your restaurant and it was fine, it had plenty of berries, sauce, and ice cream so the cake never ran 'dry'.  What I received to-go was not enough ice cream, four, JUST FOUR BERRIES in a little cup with NO SAUCE!  I could only eat about half due to the lack of sauce and not enough ice cream so the cake got 'dry'.  If you look at your website the same item is chock full of berries, sauce, and a nice heaping scoop of ice cream.  Once again (2nd time), I got ripped off.

I had also ordered an entree which was mediocre but I ate it anyway because I was starving.  I spent, with tip to the person that retrieved my order, $34.  And I spent this amount the previous time as well.  

As an aside, back in November we had extended family visit us and we ate at the Danbury location one night.  When the server brought us our drinks I noticed that my soda had a big piece of lettuce floating in it.  It did get replaced but t really made me wonder if I was given a clean cup in the first place.

Chili's Management, I am asking you to please make this right.  I have the receipt for the most recent visit the other day.  I look forward to hearing from you asap."

b'So, my "thing" here is the guac and chips (w/salsa). I\'ve lived and worked in and around Illinois, Missouri and Kentucky all of my life and recently moved to Virginia. So, it\'s safe to say that I\'ve eaten at Chili\'s restaurants in every one of these dates and I typically order the same thing across the board. I decided, this time, to ask about how fresh the guacamole was and I was told that it is made fresh at 11 o\'clock every morning; as is the salsa. I thought so, but just thought I\'d ask. This was because the last order of guacamole seemed as if it was almost frozen right in the middle. The employee denied this. \nAnyway, I got home and ate the first order of guacamole with a few chips and it was divine. I got to the second one in immediately noticed a big chunk of brown avocado. I thought that maybe this had turned after it was made, so I took it out and found more under it. When I looked around the edge of the bowl it was as if it had browned in some places, but someone tried to stir it all together and conceal the parts that had turned brown. I even mistakenly ate some of the browned avocado because a portion of it looked fresh on the top but when I tasted it and then looked closer, it was brown underneath. Disappointed doesn\'t even begin to explain what I\'m feeling. I am angry. You better believe that I will be talking to someone about this. I have added a lovely picture to show you just some of what I found. I wanted you to see it as it is tonight because it will probably brown more through the night, as avocado does, and I will be heading back to Chili\'s tomorrow.'
b'Who should I contact regarding about your poor customer service at the Skokie location?'
b'Not feelin this change...'

b'Hi, this is the "6 oz" steak I was given. When we mentioned that it wasn\'t, we were told no, it\'s 6oz, it\'s just REALLY THICK. Your manager at the location on East Beltline, Grand Rapids Michigan was smug. I\'ve done diet prep for fitness and bodybuilding shows, and to help guys prepare for their fights in the ring. I said it was 4 oz. The manager challenges me and said , "I can get a scale. Do you want me to get a scale and prove it." I had started to say no, but his tone and attitude rubbed me the wrong way. So, I agreed. I told my family it was 4 oz, and I said when he\'s wrong he\'s going to say it shrunk during cooking. He got there, set the scale down, rated it to zero, and then tried to add a plate. I raised my eyebrow, and he then fared the plate to zero. Would you like to guess how much my $15 6oz steak weighed? Suspense killing you? 4.2 oz. He then said when you cook meat, it loses 25% of it\'s weight. Again, I delved into my 40 year life experience and said it\'s medium rare, so still quite pink, and 1.8 out of 6 is about a third of the weight. He was upset at this point and said, "Fine, I\'ll take it off." I explained that I didn\'t want it removed, that we would learn from the experience not order it again. He left upset and saying with his back turned and walking away angrily that he was taking it off. His attitude was poor, like the service that saw us get an appetizer, finish two drinks each for my son and I while the bartender told our waiter that my wife\'s drink, her first, would have to wait. More than 10 minutes later, we\'d finished the app, and the bartender who hadn\'t made one drink in that time, worked on his math with receipts,slowly. Eventually, our waiter went and found another young lady to make a margarita, but she didn\'t know how. So she started and then she too had to wait on the first belligerent bartender. About 45 minutes into our 1 1/2 trek to Chilis for dinner the bartender eventually told her what to do. This is the chilis we stop by once a month to. It has never been a crappy place to go. Until last night.'

b'Dear Chiiliheads. My name is Ben Maurice Jean Runyan and I wanted to share with you the impact of a true "work family"environment at the store location of Chili's on 7335 Arroyo Crossing in Las Vegas, Nevada. The person in this picture is Norman Runyan (my brother), who over 12 years at the mentioned location served thousands of customers and trained and supported hundreds of employees. He even helped train our sister Chantal Runyan who has been at the mentioned location for several years.

In October 2016 our family learned that Norm was diagnosed with cancer. Due to his treatment regiment he was not able to work which he hated, for he loved working with his co-workers and listening to his customers. As the months grew his co-workers would visit him, talk with him and check up on him via commutation through his sister.

During the last couple of months the disease spread quicker than any of us where aware of. On April 22 he was admitted into the ICU section. He had many complications due to the cancer which placed him bed ridden. During this time in ICU ward, many of his co-workers came by the hospital to visit with him, cheer him on, hold his hand and share stories of the impact he made in their lives. I truly feel that this positive energy and encouragement from the Arroyo Crossing Chiliheads helped him to fight harder.

On May 3rd, we got the news that his journey on this planet was over. Our family is sad to see him leave, but we are thankful he is not in any more pain. I am sure he was meet at the gates with his favorite friends- Shelly, Terrell, Snickers and Glacier, four dogs that he loved.

This is a shout out to all the wonderful staff at the Chili's located on Arroyo Crossing in Las Vegas. Chantal and Norm have said wonderful things about this staff behind their backs. Norm may have been a little rough around the edges, but once you got to know him you really understood that this was a man who believed in doing your job well and that the customer needs to be the focus of attention at all times. Thank you Chiliheads for being there during this difficult time and being a supportive family for Chantal Runyan.
Ben Runyan.'

b"Chilis, 

I had a very strange and painful experience last night. We have never had a bad experience at Chilis before. We have spent many occasions:
Dates, birthdays, family dinners, etc. So we decided to go there for our two year anniversary dinner. I ordered the fajitas and dipped and coated my steak in what I thought was queso... and when I started to eat the piece and swallowed it was coated with some sort of hot oil that burned my mouth and throat. I started grabbing the drinks at the table. I downed my drink, followed by my husband's drink, and my mouth was still on fire. Our server came and could tell something was wrong. She went and got me milk. She was very sweet and seemed to feel bad about it. I started to feel very nauseous as the oil was burning all the way down. I kept going to the bathroom to heave. Fortunately nothing came, but I ran to the washroom at LEAST three times. During that time they took away the food and remade it without the oil that had burned me. I tried to eat some of the food, but my mouth and throat hurt at this point, and my stomach was churning so I ate almost nothing of the remade food I just took it home in a box. Unfortunately from being so nauseated with the smell in the closed car I pulled over and threw the food out so I didn't throw up while I was driving. I was in so much pain after having an antacid and milk I stopped on way home and grabbed ice cream. That helped some. When I woke up this morning my throat is very sore and feels swollen. I was disappointed that the manager didn't come to speak to me. I was offered no type of discount. I kept telling her I didn't want the meal but she insisted it be remade. I was offered an apology, which I do appreciate. And one free glass of milk. 

PS My husband loved his steak."

b'As someone who loves animals, I am extremely disappointed to hear that Chili\xe2\x80\x99s has not publicly adopted GAP standards for the chickens in its supply chain. My friends and I will not eat at Chili\xe2\x80\x99s until it does. Please publicly commit to meaningful welfare improvements for the chickens in your supply chain! '

b'I don\'t see a message option so I will have to post this here. We went for a dessert to go today and got the chocolate chip skillet cookie. My wife asked the server about the broken edge and the server said she asked also because she didn\'t want to serve a broken cookie, but that she was told by the kitchen that it wasn\'t broken, it was all there and that\'s how it came out of the skillet. Seriously? I think it\'s pretty obvious that it IS broken, there are EDGE pieces missing from a several inch portion, and the kitchen apparently just didn\'t want to get another cookie. status_message: b'This was AFTER two send backs then a FULL remake. Ordered the combo with Chicken Crispers, ribs and sausage. The first tray was ribs, chicken, and crispers" (nothing crispy about them) with "street corn" that had no mayonnaise or cheese. Sent it back stating we ordered sausage and the crispers were as soggy as soaked bread. Brought us out the SAME plate with COLD sausage added. Told them to remake because it still was not right. Was then brought out this plate below. The sausage was hot yet the "crispers" were still just as soggy plus the corn was STILL wrong. We spoke with the MOD yet again who then told us they were soggy because of the sauce we picked. (Mind this we come here once a week and get the SAME thing and have NEVER had the crispers soggy and gross) and that he was sorry about the corn instead of bringing a fresh piece of corn correctly made he walked off. The poor server was distraught and was left to deal with a situation the manager should have taken care of. So disappointed by the management and kitchen tonight at the Columbus GA location. If this is how your Chicken Crispers are suppose to look and taste then you need to rebrand and get your kitchen on the same terms, if not this Manager and kitchen needs to be corrected for this unappetizing piece of food. status_message:
b'Today, I decided to stop by Chili\xe2\x80\x99s for lunch.  I hadn\xe2\x80\x99t been in a while and noticed that your whole menu had pretty much changed.  So, I decided to try out your new \xe2\x80\x9cChicken and Waffles\xe2\x80\x9d combination.  I don\xe2\x80\x99t know what *chef* came up with that meal, but there was very little that was redeeming about it.  The waffles were soaked in something sweet, the chicken had some type of chipotle sauce on it, there was another drizzle of ranch (maybe??), some jalape\xc3\xb1os, and skewers holding the whole thing together.

Out of the four of these on my plate, I managed to have 1 1/2 and ate some fries.  I didn\xe2\x80\x99t want a to go box because I would\xe2\x80\x99ve just thrown it away once I brought it into the house.  The waitress felt bad - but it wasn\xe2\x80\x99t her fault.  I did not speak to a manager, nor did I ask to be comped for the meal (because I ordered it, ate part of it, so I owned it).  I probably won\xe2\x80\x99t go back to Chili\xe2\x80\x99s - not because of the service, but because of whole change of menu and the inedible plate of food.

Just out of curiosity - do you have a staff of pot-heads who come up with some of this stuff??  I mean, jalape\xc3\xb1os, waffles with syrup, along with BBQ covered wicked crispy chicken fingers MIGHT have looked appetizing when I was 18 and stoned.  Now??  It was just\xe2\x80\xa6 awful.

I\xe2\x80\x99ve included a picture of my lunch.  The fries were delicious, though!!'

b'Thank goodness my parents were there with me. I needed something to get my mind off of the terrible service. Pathetic. In addition, I found out my mom\'s potatoes weren\'t cooked all the way through.....AFTER we were finished & she was on her way out. She is just too kind of a person to even say anything. I on the other hand, would have had no problem letting the server, or manager know. I\'m a server myself & therefore know 1st hand people have no qualms about letting a staff member know when there is an issue with their food. After all, you are paying for your meal AND you are paying for service. Not sure how some servers make any money, aside from their hourly whopping rate of $2.13/hr, but that\'s not my problem, OR my business. What is my business is making sure my parents are taken care of and treated with upmost respect, anytime they are in town & we go out to eat. \nBoth of them had to look for the server just so they could get refills on their coffee. That\'s not ok. When you ask for a to go drink because 98% of your original beverage is still in the cup, the least they could do for you is bring you a full, fresh one to go.....or be mindful enough to top off the 1/2 full/1/2 empty styrofoam cup your taking with you. Please remind your staff members it\'s always good to check back once the food has been delivered to the table. ESPECIALLY when you aren\'t the one who dropped it off. Treat your guests as you like to be treated when you go out to eat.....with RESPECT. ESPECIALLY older couples. You will be there too one day.....remember that. Just my 2 cents regarding today\'s visit. If you really want the remaining ninety-eight cents worth, feel free to contact me. I certainly hope our visit was credited to my rewards acc as I had to ask another server to bring our kiosk back to the table, because for whatever reason, the server took it away, after my parents were seated there. Guess he thought they looked "shady". HAHAHAHAHA......YEAH RIGHT!!!!!'

status_message:
b"Anyone who knows me knows I am a frequent Chili's Grill & Bar patron. My daughter and I go so often that everyone that works there knows us. They know my favorite server, my back-up servers, what we eat, what we drink and I even have a regular table. That is why it was totally natural for me to involve Chili\xe2\x80\x99s with our fundraising efforts for the band organization of which my daughter is a member. After all, Chili\xe2\x80\x99s claims to be invested in their community with their \xe2\x80\x98Give Back\xe2\x80\x99 initiative. So in December 2015 we organized a fundraiser at Chili's Grill & Bar through manager Brad. We held the fundraiser as directed. Our members shows up in force only to be told after nearly 5 months of trying to get a check for our efforts that the fundraiser was not authorized or sanctioned and therefore not valid. We would earn nothing. WHAT?!? Attempts to get Chili\xe2\x80\x99s management to recognize they made the error not my organization and the fair thing to do was honor the commitment made by a member of their management staff, went nowhere. In total frustration I sent an email to Chili\xe2\x80\x99s corporate and received a call back from the local manager, Christopher Jones, within a couple days.

Have you ever felt like someone was talking to you because they had to? This is how I felt when we spoke. CJ, who I knew before this contact from being a frequent diner at Chili\xe2\x80\x99s, spoke to me in a manner that reinforced my belief that he likely had no choice. He offered my organization $260.00 to make up for the fundraiser night that was unsanctioned. Further, he gave us the opportunity to hold another \xe2\x80\x98give back\xe2\x80\x99 night to raise funds for our organization. It was required that a flyer be presented at the time of service, either hardcopy or on a cell phone. We held the fundraiser on Wednesday, April 5th. Board members of our organization participated. Member parents and families attended. A separate organization, our prom mania group, held their meeting at Chili\xe2\x80\x99s that night to support our organization. Of course, my daughter and I attended. There were many that attended. Even with all that participation, I received an email the next morning from Christopher Jones stating: \xe2\x80\x9cIt wasn\xe2\x80\x99t a good showing last night for the GBN. We only had one guest show up for this night. I spoke with Dennis every hour on the hour to see how the turn out was going. Maybe we can setup another one for you on a future date. I am always available for you. My number is 504-205-0650.\xe2\x80\x9d

Obviously, I could have been knocked over with a feather. The impression I received from Mr. Jones was totally accurate. He was less than enthused at having to contact me or work with my organization for this fundraiser. To date, I have yet to hear anything further about the $260.00 check I was supposed to receive; even though I asked to be told in advance once the check was released. Now the fundraiser we held and no less than 25 parties (that I know of personally) attended is yet again NOT RECOGNIZED BY CHILI\xe2\x80\x99S IN LAPLACE. Further contact to Mr. Jones will not be made. Instead, I sent another email to Chili\xe2\x80\x99s corporate and am waiting on a response. We will see how this goes.

My frequent visits to Chili\xe2\x80\x99s Laplace will cease. I will not patronize any establishment that cannot support my daughter or the organizations that I believe in when they claim this is exactly what they do. This Chili\xe2\x80\x99s does not. The falsification of the lack of our participation is deplorable, but offers a clear insight of their true meaning of \xe2\x80\x98give back\xe2\x80\x99. It means sucker people into coming to \xe2\x80\x98give back\xe2\x80\x99 their money to Chili\xe2\x80\x99s. This location (because I will not imply they represent the entire corporation) should be ashamed of their actions clearly demonstrated by twice taking money out of the hands of a non-profitable organization that\xe2\x80\x99s sole emphasis is on the musical education of children. Shame on you Chili\xe2\x80\x99s Laplace. Shame on you Christopher Jones. You don\xe2\x80\x99t have to worry about me coming to you again and your \xe2\x80\x98offer\xe2\x80\x99 to try again will not be taken up. Instead, it is time for me to show you my disgust and disappointment by boycotting your location and asking all member of our organization to do the same.

To all member of our Marching Pride that attended this fundraiser and feel the same as I do, please send your thoughts and concerns in email to brinkerguestrelations@epowercenterdirect.com and include Reference Number 1400927 to identify that we all stand together. If you feel so inclined, you may also contact Mr. Jones on his cell phone to let him know the mistake he has made. Chili\xe2\x80\x99s corporate should be embarrassed by the actions of this store and its management. Will I ever eat at a Chili\xe2\x80\x99s restaurant again? Probably. But I can promise it won\xe2\x80\x99t be in Laplace, La. Guess it\xe2\x80\x99s time to visit another favorite manager at her store in Chili's Grill & Bar Springs, LA."

b"We went to the Chili's in Mililani, HI for dinner tonight. Headed there early and we were seated around 1630. Usually we have a great experience, but it seems you changed the way you cook the grilled cheese. My daughter barely ate her food and my son refused to eat his because it was so badly burnt. Is there a way to request to have a grilled cheese cooked in a pan and not open-faced in a heating unit/broiler? My son's grilled cheese was so burned it was peeling off from the unheated cheese underneath it.
We showed our server, who was very kind, and she took our plate and brought out a bowl of rice and more pineapple for my son, as I requested. The rice was nice and hot, but he started spitting out bites and I noticed that throughout the entire bowl of rice there were bits of completely dried chunks of rice. Seems that the rice had dried out in whatever container it was being held in in the kitchen and they just mixed it all together instead of throwing out the dried off sections first.
The food my husband and I received was good and the pineapple was fresh. I've never had an issue with the grilled cheese in our few trips to Chili's and I was very upset with how poorly they were made today - especially for the price. I'd love to know if it is possible to request having a grilled cheese made in a pan so that the cheese actually melts properly.
Thank you for your time."

b'My spouse and I visited Millerville Chilis tonight. Very bad experience. I am a very good tipper. I understand new people have to learn, and some mistakes are okay... I have been a server and I know how it is to have to deal with all kinds of people. Needless to say, this new waiter got no tip. It took forever for us to get our dessert (chocolate molten cake). Then, when it finally came out, the hard shell was missing, and when I told the waiter he decided to argue with me about it. He told me it wasnt a shell it was just fudge but he would be glad to put more fudge. And then just kept going back and fourth with me about it. Needless to say, he decided to ask someone else and then came back with the hardening chocolate and asked if I still wanted it. Didnt apologize or anything. Couldnt even admit he was wrong. I am posting a picture of what we were given.'

b"I just have to say I am a huge fan of Chili's normally. Tonight we went to the Freehold location and I walked out very disappointed. I ordered the steak fajitas with just peppers (only cheese and lettuce on the side), which is a staple for me, and when it came out I was very surprised at what I saw. Normally at any other time/location the skillet is filled with steak & peppers sizzling away. This time I got maybe 6 pieces of steak and a hand full of peppers (see picture). I asked for more peppers, which they gave me, but they weren't hot and sizzling like what would be delivered when it first comes out. I still had to pay full price for a mix & match which was $12.99 plus $2 for ordering steak. And it wasn't like I got double the steak amount since I was supposed to get two! I'm very disappointed. As much as I love going to Chili's, I don't think I'll be going back for a while. This experience has left a very bad taste in my mouth."

b"Went out to eat tonight for\nMy husbands birthday, he wanted Chilis. Unfortunately, he didn't get what he wanted. This picture was taken at 6:58pm on a Thursday. There was 5 of us---They told us there was a 45 minute wait. NOT A SINGLE PERSON IN THIS WHOLE SECTION including booths you can't see . (I will add another picture in the comment section), yes there were other people waiting at the door besides us... so we ended up going to the restaurant next door. Even if your short staffed... sit the people at tables and explain there might be a little wait..."

b"Had an awful experience at your Springfield, MA location. Went to dinner this evening with my husband, another couple, and a toddler. Drinks took approximately 25 minutes to receive and our food took close to 50 minutes. Three of the five meals were cold and the fourth fajita meal turned cold by the time the tortillas were brought (10 minutes later). When voicing our concerns to the sever, we were told there was a new kitchen staff being trained and offered us a free dessert. After being at the half full restaurant for two hours the thought of waiting for anymore food was absolutely not what we wanted to do. We couldn't figure out how the new kitchen staff effected the drinks coming from the bar. The two tables around us were having the same issues and one requested the manager. We heard the table behind us ask the manager to stop at our table, as well, but nobody came. The frustration was not worth an $85 dinner."
b'Having to choose your favorite Smokehouse Meats? The struggle is real.'

Chili\xe2\x80\x99s restaurants in two states are coming under fire from pro-life advocates for giving 15% of patron\xe2\x80\x99s meal purchases to the Planned Parenthood abortion business.

Earlier this week the Planned Parenthood abortion business affiliate in Indiana and Kentucky posted a promotional code its supporters could use to request that Chili\xe2\x80\x99s donate 15% of the pre-tax meal purchase to benefit the abortion corporation.

According to the image the abortion company posted, its supporters can bring the voucher to any of the identified Chili\xe2\x80\x99s locations participating in the give back program. The voucher is good weather people purchasing food at Chili\xe2\x80\x99s dine in the restaurant or order food to go. status_message: b"My husband and I received a generous gift card for Christmas from a family member. We hadn't eaten at this location in quite  awhile due to poor food and service. But we wanted to give the management the benefit of the doubt and give Chili's another chance. We went to a Chili's Housecreek #261, Raleigh NC, near our home. I ordered the cheese enchiladas, it came with beans and rice. The plate was set in front of me, and it was disgusting. The plate was messy. The beans and rice both had a hard crust on them. The beans had actually burst open from being under warming lights way too long. I contemplated calling over the server to complain, but I didn't want to cause a scene. So I tried two bites of the enchilada, and it was absolutely awful. I couldn't eat it, and pushed away my plate. I had two servers ask is I wanted a to go box, and I declined. I wasn't asked if there was something wrong. We payed the check, and left quietly. The more I thought about it, I decided to bring it to your attention. This was the only location that we've ever had a problem. Needless to say, we will not return to this location. That plate should have never left the kitchen in this condition!"

b"This evening we called in an order to pick up at our local Mesa, Arizona Chili's. After repeating our order about 4 times, my husband picked up our food, only for the server to catch that they had forgotten an order of fries on one of the orders. Got them and my husband came home. We opened the boxes to find that they had actually forgotten the fries on both of the orders, but only replaced one of them. Then as I'm almost done eating my steak and shrimp, I find a sticker under my food for what I'm guessing was the sauce on my steak but uh oh, it's labeled that it was supposed to be discarded yesterday. Picture of our receipts and the discard sticker below. Needless to say I'm not happy. I'll expect a reply soon."

b'I got take out from the Providence RI store tonight and I have never been more disgusted in my entire life. My fianc\xc3\xa9 picked up the food as he usually does and as we're opening the food containers, my food did not appear in the slightest appetizing for lack of better words. My fianc\xc3\xa9 called the store and the woman that answered the phone genuinely apologized and asked if we would want to pick up a new order which we agreed because the least we want is to give people a hard time or resort going on Facebook so unfortunately this isn't the end of our experience tonight. As my fianc\xc3\xa9 gets to the restaurant to get the new order, the same employee that had helped him prior approached him to apologize stating she knew he would be back as she herself saw the order and expressed concern to her manager that "that can't be served that way" where in turn she said her manager stated "who cares". I'm not sure how much of it is true but I'm guessing it's a high percentage considering that I received BLACK AND GREY OLD SHRIMP. I've done the favor and attached a picture. I will NEVER be ordering from the Providence store again

P.S. As I am typing this my fianc\xc3\xa9 came in through the door and I opened my food again and the same BLACK AND GREY SHRIMP on this order also. I've always enjoyed the Spicy Shrimp Tacos and have had them a copious amount of times. THIS IS NOT THE WAY THEYRE SUPPOSED TO LOOK. 

Unfortunately you folks have lost a long time customer.'

status_message:
b'VETERAN DISRESPECTED AND FOOD TAKEN AWAY AT Chili's Grill & Bar 

"I was approached by an old white guy, maybe in his 70s, with a Trump Shirt, at Chili's on Veteran's Day yesterday. He asked if I was in the 24th unit, and I said "no the 25th". TRICK QUESTION. He said he was in Germany, and that they did not let Blacks serve over there. He left to the back, and came back and rubbed my dog Barack, who is a service dog. I was seated and eating my food. The waitress packed the rest of my food in a to go box because I had to go pick up my wife. I got my food and tipped the waitress. Then the Manager, MR. Wesley Patrick, comes from the same area in the back, walked up, and rudly informs me that a guest said that I was not a real soldier because I had my hat on indoors. Other guests heard him. He asked for my military ID, I was calm, and provided it to him. I also provided him with my DD214 which is my discharge paperwork. At that point he should have just said "I am sorry Sir, thank you for your service' Instead he followed up with "the guest also said your dog is not a service dog." Barack had his Red Service Vest on, and his Certified Service Tags. I was sitting for 35 minutes prior with Barack beforehand. At this point I was grossly offended embarrassed dehumanized and started Recording...Mr. Wesley snatched my food away, made body contact assaulting me...see for yourself" 

Video Credit: Ernest Blackbatman https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100012925955468&hc_ref=SEARCH&fref=nf'

Bless you, sir!
Brad"

status_message: b"My friend and I were dining at the Chili's in San Bruno when we decided to take a cute commemorative photo to celebrate our wonderful supper. This is the aftermath.. do you see the ghost? It's between us, it's head above the iconic chilis pepper, and it's shoes below.. I believe those are yeezys! The ghost of a disgruntled employee, perhaps? I demand our money back for this traumatizing experience!"
b"So this makes a lot of sense chili's....\n\nLet's waste money on paper bags to stick your silverware in after all the good old fashion napkin wrap I guess doesn't make sense."

b'My family and I went to Chili's today for lunch. I ordered table side guac .

When the waitress brought out the "table side guac", she plopped the prepacked container of old avocados in front of me (with the lid and sticker on it).  The date on the top read "Discard 9/25/16".  The date today is 9/27/16".  I asked for the manager and he came over and quickly took it away.  From the looks of it he yelled at the waitress.  He took the guac off our bill then hid in the kitchen.  Sent the server out to apologize and deal with us. (We did pay the rest of the bill, and tipped on the full amount...wasn't her fault).  

If they're serving old guac, what else are they serving expired?! Disgusting.

*Highlands Ranch location, 12:59 p.m, 9/27.  We paid by amex if you need to verify our service, although the payment pad was out of order, they did take our card and run it.

Trying to refrain from posting all over social media, so I looked for a corporate email address, but there is none to send this picture to. Has been posted on yelp.

WOW! ???????'
b'$95.. No wonder the Chilis in Dover is almost always empty.'

b"Shout out to Chili's #534, near BWI in Maryland!

My family was up north for a wedding and last night we decided to have dinner at the Chili's near our hotel.  My mom mentioned to the server that I was a nurse at St. Jude (she's a proud mom and I'm a person who doesn't like attention brought to me so I was caught off guard that she mentioned it).  Our waitress shared her own families personal struggle with pediatric cancer and the manager, Paul, came to talk to me and told me how they always strive to do well for St. Jude!  They treated us like royalty, and obviously didn't have too!  They had a couple of t-shirts and koozies, left from the event that he gave to me to share, discounted our meal, and printed this special note that I will hang on our bulletin board so all the families can see it!!  

It humbles me too see so many people come together for a cause that I love and cherish.  I myself am just a teensy piece of the equation.  

I actually work on our BMT unit which is housed in the chilis care center!!  I can't thank you all enough for all you do!!"

b"We took my son to a surprise dinner at his favorite restaurant and notice all employees wearing St. Judes shirts & have items for purchase to support them. b'Do any of you guys like to be free to select what's best for you?  We all do that, right?  None of us desire to be tied down. No one wants someone telling us what we can and can't do.

What if I told you there is a man, full of integrity and honesty, who desires the government to "stay out of your bedroom and out of your wallet"?  Gary Johnson is that man. 

He's a little more than your average Joe. He was a highly successful two-term governor in a largely Democratic state. While in office, he balanced the budget, increased jobs and left the state with new highways, hospitals and schools all while balancing the budget and allowing a billion dollar surplus in the state's bank account. 

I could run on and on about the good things about Gary Johnson and his policies. I am so energized about his campaign! Being involved has given me a new perspective and hope in American government. 

If you want more freedom, less taxes, a balanced national budget, and a final bow to endless wars then check out Gary Johnson at:  

https://www.johnsonweld.com/

Reject slavery. Choose freedom. You in?

b'Myself and my family eat at your restaurant on Brainerd Rd in Chattanooga, TN very frequently. We even have a favorite server every time. The restaurant was not even half full, but there was no one bussing tables or cleaning except servers in between the multiple tables they had. No manager ever came out and one of our orders was incorrect. The servers were doing the best they could with what they had and keeping up with theirs tables while constantly getting new ones. The server was not the issue at all, she did great. We almost walked out before sitting because it was so nasty, but were hungry so we stayed. Not what anyone wants to look at while having a family meal...'

b'I will never have another birthday at Chili\'s again, walked in got a table got handed the menus, and our server came along to take drink orders I mentioned that it was my birthday, I got a "ok", I asked for a refill, a different sever came by with my drink and saw a birthday badge that I was wearing, he said happy birthday, then the same server came by and asked for deserts, I said to her I will have a slice of birthday cake, "ok what one?" b'Im blind, and got my dog from a wonderful school. The rule used to be that if a dog failed out as a guide, they were trained to stay with an autistic child one on one creating bonds and keeping them from bolting without warning. New management seeks to stop that and use one dog per school and only help kids during school hours IF they will bond. It gave us great comfort that if our dogs failed out, they continued to serve. Please help support and promote a wonderful program to keep it in play. Thank you.\n\n'
link_name: b'#SaveHeelingAutism a program that pairs #GuidingEyes Service Dogs with Children with Autism'

b"My family and I went to dinner here in Chico Ca. At Chilis and I have to give a HUGE shout out to this hard working guy right here. Unfortunately I have a bad memory with names but every time we have come here we have had him and he is the best waiter I've ever had. Being a former waitress I know how hard it is to keep every table u have happy and this guy goes out of his way to make sure that happens. 
In the picture is a result of my youngest daughter gettin a hold of some mashed potatoes and loving them so much she decided her hair needed some too. When I asked for a rag to try to clean her up this wonderful boy got a brand new rag and came out and cleaned it up. My daughter adored it after she took her inspection of him in this picture lol. 
After speaking to the young man we had discovered he is trying to transfer to a restaurant down south. We did leave an outstanding review for him at the chico restaurant but I would really like to make it a point to get this boy recognized. He seems to be such a good hearted always smiling and hard working young man. I highly recommend transferring him and giving him a chance where ever he may go. I wish more people his age would work as hard as he does. Good luck man. Thank u so much for such a GREAT experience.
Update: his name is Ryan Stanart"

b"In Nanny Hands, is a family group trying save our beloved Nanny Home!

Sherry Butler was an amazing woman who loved all, forgave all and always knew what to say. Many called her Mom or Nanny. She loved doodle and she loved Elvis. But most of all she loved her family. But Nanny passed with many health problems.

Now that her house is empty, people have moved in and trashed it. We find this very heart breaking. Nanny loved her home and loved her yard with many flower beds. 

My name is Taylor, I'm married to Joshua. We got married June 9th 2013, day after my husband graduated boot camp. We moved to Fort Hood couple days later. Then my husband found out about him having liver and lung disease. Was chaptered out in 2014.We have 2yr old son (Jay)  and nearly 3month old daughter (ScaRlett). Ever since we have bounced from house to house for 3yrs. I just want my babies to have place call home. 

My family and I are taking over house after year and half. Plain do everything we can to save her house. So Little Jay and ScaRlett will have place call home. And be able to honor our Nanny home like should been done in first place. 

Because we are such low income. We asking all who want to help to please help. We need materials (plywood, flooring, paint, doors, switch covers, door nobs, fencing, ect.) Also will need appliances, (stove, fridge). Cleaning supplies are also plus, (bleach, brooms, mops, rags, trash bags, gloves, bug spray, lawn mower, weed eater, ect.) 
Not needs, but things need after house fixed.. 
(Couch, blinds, dishes, washer & dryer(hook ups), small dining table.) 

gofundme.com/innannyhands45

We appreciate everyone who wants help. Every penny counts and every piece of material counts. To ones who can't afford help or have nothing give. But still want to help. Just pray for our house and family. We aren't asking for for people feel bad for us. We just asking anyone who has material laying around just pass it our way. Anyone who has unused gift cards to (Walmart/ Lowes/ Home Depo) pass them  our way. 

Contact Sherron & Rc 9033564166 for more information.
Thank you for reading my story, God Bless You All <3"
link_name: b'Click here to support In Nanny Hands by Joshua Green'

b"My sister Soycoya & I literally just left your 6324 Glenwood Ave, Raleigh, NC 27612 location.  We waited 15 minutes for our drink orders to be taken and waited 7 minutes to get them.  Our waiter, Brian, was either new or distracted. He was polite but didn't seem to know much. I ordered the 2 cheeseburgers for $15 special for my daughter & I; one regular & one with only ketchup. The latter came out fully loaded & I asked for it to be changed. A guy, I'm guessing a manager (older man, gray/brown hair, glasses, dressed in all black) came over to say ''I hear you want a plain burger.''  I said a cheeseburger with only ketchup.  He goes on to tell me I basically want a plain burger & stood there debating whether it was plain or add ketchup. I shook my head in disgust as he walked away. My back was to him but my niece saw him roll his eyes & throw his hands up to gesture ''what's her problem''. I told my waiter to cancel the order & my sister, the kids and I left. We love Chili's but this crew working tonight gave you guys a bad name.  We are now at Lynnwood Grill being treated amazingly by Ally, our waiter, and the rest of the crew!"
b'Seriously disappointed.'
b'Please let the Burleson, TX location management see this and handle it immediately'

b"Chili's never fails to disappoint me. It doesn't even matter which one I go to, you continue to show your incompetence. I would love to know what your Citrus Chile sauce tastes like but everytime I order the Citrus-Chile Avocado Sirloin you fail to put the sauce on it (3 different times now). Also all 3 times I have ordered I have asked for medium rare, I am starting to believe Chili's only cooks steaks to one temperature, well done. I have added a picture of my so called Medium rare steak which I needed to break out my battery powered reciprocating saw to cut up because my steak knife wasn't cutting it. The most insulting part of my last experience was that it was a to go order and I tipped the people $5 for food I threw away because it wasn't what I ordered or edible. It's sad that this is what Chili's has become."
b'Often imitated, never duplicated.'

b'DO NOT go to Chili\'s in Kingsport, TN! Waited over 40 minutes for lunch when we were almost the only people there (the excuse was "lots of carry out orders"). Then, my food came out with bacon when I ordered none. They insisted they would re cook it, but instead brought it back to me with the cheese/bacon peeled off, bacon remains still on the plate, and the avacodo smelling and tasting of bacon. This is a clear health code violation and I am reporting it ASAP!'

b'Tried to message, but could not find option, so I guess I have to post. Ordered carry out tonight and when checking out, the employee opened each order to show me it was correct, but when she opened mine, Cajun pasta, I noticed the garlic bread was not with the order. I asked if it still came with garlic bread and the employee said yes, and just stared at me. A second later she asked if I would like mine and I said, yes please. She went away and came back, saying that they were really busy and forgot to make it, so it would take another five to six minutes, and wanted to know if I still wanted the garlic bread. I said that I wouldn\'t have asked for it if I didn\'t want it, but I would have appreciated it if I didn\'t have to wait for it, while the rest of my food got cold. She said that she could get me a drink or chips and salsa for the order, which I declined, saying that I didn\'t really want a drink or salsa. She said she would get the manager, who came over and stated it would be another 1-2 minutes and stated that if I wanted to continue to wait, she would put my order under the heat lamp, yum yum. Or I could just leave without the garlic bread *implied. After waiting for approximately 6 minutes the order was ready and I left with my fresh garlic bread and heat lamped food. \n\nOnce home, I began to relate the story to my wife, complaining of the service or lack of it in this town and upon opening my order of Cajun pasta, immediately noticed what appeared to be a black hair wrapped around a piece of pasta. Disgusted, I used the supplied plastic fork and removed the hair and realized it wasn\'t a hair, but what actually appeared to be a cockroach antennae. I immediate got up and drove back to the restaurant and showed the wonderful addition to my food to the employee I originally dealt with, her eyes got big and she said she would have the manager "fix" this.  While there, my wife sent me a picture of her fried pickles, stating that I should also show them her order, as half the fried pickles was just the fried breading without pickles. The employee showed the manager the pasta with cockroach additives and the manager came over to me and said that she was sorry and could make my food again. I told her that I did not want to eat any food from her restaurant and showed her the picture my wife had just sent. She stated that she could make the order again or refund my money. I told her again that I did not want to eat any food from her restaurant and requested the refund. She asked how i paid, which was partially with a gift card and the rest on my credit card. She refunded the small amount to my credit card and then asked where the employee placed the gift card I used. The employee pointed to the trash. You guessed it. The manager dug through the trash and handed the gift card back to me saying that the total would be refunded back onto the card. Really??? Out of the trash???  No wonder you have pieces of insects in your food.  Thanks for the experience.'

b"During my time of employment at chilis bar and grill, (York PA) I took this picture. I was hired on March 26, 2016. I quit tonight; May 8, 2016. I was trying to push through my shift on Mother's Day so that I could get home to spend it with my mother. 
I was at the home stretch of my shift, when an annoyed customer came over and said that their table was dirty and requested another. So, as any employee would do, I directed them toward another table. But, that table was also dirty. On my way to get my manager, I slipped and fell once I entered the kitchen. The floor was COVERED in a slime made of mashed up food and water. I had recently ask one of the managers if the kitchen was even sanitary enough to be serving food, and he assured me that it was. 
Does this look sanitary to you? I am honestly shocked that no one has had food poisoning. I accepted this job because I'm trying to pay car insurance and have some extra money for college. I need money, but I don't need it this bad. 
Chili's is disgusting, and I advice everyone in York county to never eat at the chilis location on concord road. 
They do not clean anything properly. I regret not leaving sooner. I'm glad I left while I had the chance. 
Be wary of where you eat. You never know what's going on behind closed doors."

b'So tonight we went to Chilis in Green Bay after Sapphira rocked the runway. It was the most awful service we have ever had there. Hostess had an attitude, waitress was slow and rude, our food came out separately, like 20 minutes for all food, Emily\'s food was burned, mine and my moms was cold, chicken was not cut properly (we had fajitas) and as you can see by the picture the portion was off, it\'s like someone ate half of it. Fajitas usually come to the table sizzling.. No sizzling just cold chicken, that we waited 20 minutes for after the first person was served their food. the manager said we were lying, and made excuses that because of Carrie Underwood they were busy and backed up. Was it busy? Yes- however I have been in there when it\'s even busier with a party of 20- all of our food was served together, the waitress came back several times, and everything was delicious. Tonight they had a total of seven servers- 4 in the bar, and 3 in the other area where we were seated. Not enough for a "packed" restaurant. Which the manager said they anticipated but didn\'t figure it out ahead of time. Chilis is my favorite restaurant and it was so disappointing this time. What put it over the top was instead of apologizing the manager wanted to fight with us, when we would not engage he said that we always seem to have problems and complaining about the food. (Not true- I\'ve actually written corporate three times with compliments) he even refused to give us his name. And all this above is just the tip of the ice berg. I can say that is the last time I am going to Chilis in Green Bay for a very long time! By the looks of the reviews on this page Chilis needs to get it together! Maybe go back to the basics of good service with a friendly face!'

b'Went to get carry at 5851 Bee Ridge in Sarasota while on vacation. Paid  with debit card inside at carry out. Next morning fraud detection called that numerous charges had been made to my account. Looked at my account online. My card was ran twice from this location. Once for the bill that I signed for and again for a very small amount. Manager only shows one transaction- made police report.\nManager on duty did not seem to be concerned.'

b'We usually come to Chilis for dinner here in Qatar. We dine there atleast 2-3 times a month. We usually order Wings over buffalo, Monterey Chicken, Santa Fe Chicken Salad,  Margarita Grilled chicken or one of their combo plates like Margarita Chicken with Salmon.

On every visit, we get "raw chicken" on our table. And its not an exaggeration. It happens on every visit. Each time we'll have raw chicken, we would just request to get the chicken cooked a little bit more. For this to happen once or twice.. I would say it is tolerable. We understand that mistakes can happen sp. at times when the restaurant is busy. But this happened so many times. Been done repetitively by your chef that it happens on every visit. It is awful and very dissappointing. 

On our next visits, we try to mention to our server to cook the chicken "well done" to avoid having another raw chicken incident. A request that we should NOT be even doing because we are not ordering a steak! It's chicken and there's no other way chicken should be cooked but well cooked! 

We have been very patient and understanding each time we would get this poor service since we love the variety of food that the restaurant offers. This is the reason why we keep on coming back.

However, our dining experience tonight was the worst dining we ever had! We ordered Chicken Enchilada soup that had raw chicken bits on it, it was changed twice but we still ended up having raw chicken in the soup. Until we decided to just have the soup WITHOUT the chicken to be on the safe side. Next, comes our Ancho Salmon and Chicken plate combo. And again, another raw item on our plate.. the salmon was raw. It was pink and translucent! We asked for the manager and told him about the salmon as well as the raw chicken we had earlier in our soup. Some people can eat raw fish, but we didnt go to Chili's to order sushi! The manager offered to get a new plate which we politely declined since we only wanted to bring the issue to his attention anyway. I took pictures of the dish in case you would like to see it. There you can see the salmon's only cooked part was a tiny edge. The rest of it was completely raw. To top it off, we still paid for this raw fish! 

I would say overall, that all these are very unacceptable. It is unfair for any customer to receive such poor service. Also as a restaurant, you should be fully aware that serving RAW chicken is very unsafe!

We are extremely dissapointed.'

b"The Chili's on 5005 Old Hickory Blvd, Hermitage, TN 37076 just gave us the WORST customer service I have ever experienced. My coworker and I decided to venture out of the office today and settled on Chili's. We sat ourselves in the bar area for faster service. From the time we sat down the service declined with each passing moment. It took about 10 minutes just to get a glass of water. Eventually after we flagged her down the server for the bar area made her way to take our order. We ordered from the 2 for 20 menu, the appetizer was decent but took forever to arrive. For our entr\xc3\xa9e I ordered the Bacon Cheeseburger with no cheese as I'm lactose intolerant. It is just easier to order the burger as is minus the cheese vs listing everything I want on a regular burger. Once my meal arrived, I began to prep my burger in the usual way, by removing the bun to add the condiments. The first things I noticed was there was NO bacon, or tomato. The second thing I noticed was evidence that they\xe2\x80\x99d added cheese and made the lack luster attempt to remove it after to fact. There were smaller strips of melted cheese on the burger and bun. Had I not removed the bun I would have consumed the burger cheese and all. This might not seem like a big deal but I am EXTREMELY sensitive to anything dairy and even the smallest amount can cause major digestive issues. When I alerted the waitress that there was an issue with the burger, she immediately offered to notify the manager for us to speak with.\n\nThe waitress returned after about 10 minutes and stated the Manager couldn\xe2\x80\x99t come out and he had given her his override card to comp the entr\xc3\xa9e portion of the meal and the next time we come to the restaurant the meal would be taken care of. However she never presented us with anything to support that this would happen. Since we paid for our beverages in cash the waitress took our case but never returned with a receipt. At this point we decided that we needed to contact the corporate office. I spoke with a representative who informed me that the general manager would reach out to us. The general manager did callback as promised. This experience was no better that what we had just endured at the restaurant. He was not empathetic and his response seemed almost scripted. He did not allow me to get many words in edgewise, he spoke over me and then ended the call abruptly by saying he would call the restaurant to find out what happened. This is unacceptable on all accounts. I will NEVER eat at another Chili\xe2\x80\x99s as this was not the first bad experience. This was in fact the second experience were I received poor customer service."

b"As many parents know it's exhausting having a child who is fighting a cold. We decided to order Chili's Grill & Bar and have DoorstepDelivery.com Jacksonville deliver it to us.
My husband opened up his container and it contained RAW chicken! I immediately called Chili's.  Did they own up for their mistake. Nope, not at all. Were they apologetic? Not in the least bit. 
You know what they told me?! Call Doorstep because they're suppose to double check it. I, however reminded her that her company is the one who cooked it.
I called Doorstep to see what I needed to do. They were more than willing to help, even though none of it was their fault. They called Chili's and was able to get the refund that we deserved.
Not only did my husband have to finish cooking his own food he also had to add sauce on it because that was missing as well. THANK YOU Doorstep for fixing someone else's mistake!"

b"September 5, 2010

We ate dinner at the Chili's in McDonough, Ga after visiting the hospital for a x-ray for my daughter, Maddie.

 A normal dinner with the kids wanting to donate a dollar each to St. Jude's. 

As we are leaving the parking lot, we get a phone call from the doctor at the hospital asking us to come back the next day for a follow up. 24 hours later, we are admitted to Children's Healthcare of Atlanta and my daughter begins treatment for stage four neuroblastoma.

February 10, 2011

The phone rang at 8:00 PM, and it is my daughters oncologist calling us to tell her that her latest scan is clear and she is declared no evidence of disease. She still has almost a year of treatment left, but this is the point of no looking back. The point of no return.

February 10, 2016

Five years strong. 

Five years later, we are back at the same Chili's, celebrating with friends and family five years of remission. The food, while a little slow coming out of the kitchen, with delicious. The waitstaff pleasant and smiling.

Thank you Chili's. We will see you in five years."

b"My family was in the Chili's in Apex, NC tonight and something very sweet happened. At the end of the meal I was trying to pay the bill on the tabletop kiosk, and it wasn't working. When our server came back around I asked her if the system was down, and she said no that someone in the restaurant had taken care of our bill, and she handed us this. My husband and I both started crying at the table. To the person who did this (hopefully you will see this!), you have no idea what a well timed blessing this was. My husband (the veteran mentioned in the note) has had a bit of a rough week, and has been feeling pretty down lately. This was just the pick-me-up he needed! Thank you, thank you, thank you, and we hope you have a wonderful Christmas!"

status_message: b'George Dolphin and I were at Chili\'s Restaurant, King of Prussia early tonight for dinner. When we got our bill, we were shocked to find a charge of $1.99 for "games." We have been to CHii\'s restaurants plenty of times and have used the little kiosk at the table at least 3-4 times. NEVER told there was a charge for playing the fun games (we love Trivia) while waiting for food to come. NEVER charged before, I think (now I don\'t know).\nUgh! NEVER informed of a charge on screen prior to starting Trivia game. We told our waiter Derek (awesome) and he apologized several times. He had already taken this issue to management before and will do so again tonight. Derek offered that what makes this issue worse is that some Chili\'s establishments charge, some don\'t; some table kiosks inform you prior to start of any games, some do not!!!! If we hadn\'t already paid our bill he would have removed it. It\'s not the $1.99 price tag, but it\'s something they attach to your bill without your knowledge, and it\'s deceptive and just plain WRONG!! Those devices were installed initially to order at your table so they could hire less workers. Now they keep them there to entertain you, allow you to order another round of drinks direct to the bar, and then charge you for it.\nBeware of the $2 upcharge whenever you go to CHili\'s ANYWHERE in the world and touch the table kiosk!'
