b"Chili's please work on your staffing issues at your 207 W. Spokane Falls Blvd. Spokane WA location.  Your bartender has way too many duties to handle. During my visit today I ordered chicken fajitas when my order arrived it had two tortillas (really only two for all that chicken??)... I quickly ran out and waited a while for the bartender to actually be at the bar for a moment so that I could ask for more. Then I waited 15 minutes more, the bartender came back and asked if I was okay, I reminded the bartender who said someone must have forgotten to bring them out. So I finally get my extra tortillas (three this time) they were clearly once warmed but weren't so much anymore and my food on my plate had long lost that fajitas sizzle everyone enjoys so much and was instead semi-cold at this point as well. I love Chili's, I stop in at a lot of locations when on the road for work. Today I was disappointed though and just thought I would let you know.

Thanks 
Stephen Colby"

b"Hi there - I came across this on the bully project...  can you confirm that something is being done to rectify this problem immediately?

____________________________________________________

Today WE STAND with the Caspar Family from Pittsburgh Mills, Pennsylvania. Please help lift them up and amplify this important message!
Please share: Chili\xe2\x80\x99s in the Pittsburgh Mills thinks it\xe2\x80\x99s OK to use the word \xe2\x80\x98retarded\xe2\x80\x99 and call people \xe2\x80\x98retards\xe2\x80\x99 (management and employees). Bruce (my husband) has brought the use of this word up time and time again even requesting a meeting regarding it, and nothing was done. Yesterday, he was called a retard again in front of management and when he made it clear to everyone near that our son has Down syndrome and he will not tolerate that word, management said, \xe2\x80\x98You can leave then.\xe2\x80\x99 So he did. He went in today to work his shift and they had his shift covered. In two years he has called off maybe three times due to a surgery he had and two that our son had. He\xe2\x80\x99s never late and he goes in when others call off or when it\xe2\x80\x99s asked of him. Apparently hate speech is allowed and even defended there\xe2\x80\xa6 I would not call that place \xe2\x80\x98family friendly.\xe2\x80\x99 This is disrespectful to not only my family but everyone who knows someone with Down syndrome or has Down syndrome themselves! Join me in the fight to end the use of this offensive word and in holding the appropriate people accountable for their actions!
Read more: http://huff.to/1MwnN4p
Support the Caspar's petition at: http://chn.ge/1D98U4Q"
link_name: b'Dad Says He Was Fired For Asking Coworkers Not To Say The R-Word'

status_message: b'So my husband and I just celebrated our 15 year wedding anniversary at chilis in Simi Valley, Ca.  Reason being....we met working there.  And...it is where he proposed..table 1.  I worked there for 10 years, and had trained him as he came on board.  We were blessed to work with so many wonderful people, other stores had to cover our store on our wedding day, so awesome.  Tonight we want to thank the general manager Jamie and Sarah for helping make our anniversary special.  Oh...when he proposed, our family and friends came walking up and I was super embarrassed, which I why I hid under the table...silly and young. (The restaurant has recently been remodeled from booth to table). We also had our rehearsal dinner there.  Thank you for everything. Love Scott and Kelly Silva. #226.'

status_message:
b'I always loved Chili's.  My first real date with the woman who's become my wife happened at one in Westport, Kansas City.  

Until recently I thought there wasn't a Chili's close to us, then I learned there was one at the airport.  I thought it would be great to take my wife there as a nice little nod to our dating years and suspected we'd end up going regularly again.

That said, my good memories cannot overcome your company's inaction in regard to your employees calling the Father of a special child "retarded" and his effective dismissal by the manager for calling out the employees using the word.   

Until this is resolved my family and I will not set foot in a Chili's again.'

Not only did you back out of a fund raiser for the National Autism Assoc that provides Big Red Safety Boxes for families with children with autism for prevention of wandering...you allow a man to get fired when he asked his fellow employees not to use the word retard because he's the father of a child with Down's Syndrome...now this. Oh and by the way, we've lost 5 children with autism since June 1st 2015 to wandering, drowning and being hit by a train. b"So my mom wanted to eat at her favorite place chili's.  So she always orders her spinach dip.. we finally had ordered then our waiter comes after about 10 mins and asks my mom do u want the spinach now before the other food comes put and she said yes.. well another 10mins pass and our waiter says they ran out of the spinach.  She had to order something else and wasn't pleased. We asked to speak to mgr on duty her name was Leslie to see if there was something she could do.. and she said no and I ask not even a discount on her one item she had on her receipt and she said no and that it wasn't her fault what was going on accommodated it. I was very upset the way she reacted she could have at least been more front about it and honored it especially if the item was one that was being advertised in our table. It was a Saturday they should have had the product. We were unsatisfied with our food and the service and how the mgr handled the situation."
b'Worts nachos EVER! Horrible flavor, burned tortillas, salty. \nPersonnel has lack of customer service skills.'

b"This picture doesn't really do this rant justice, but here I go anyway. I ordered a medium steak from Chili's here in Clarksville, TN. When I cut into it, it was completely purple and dripping blood. Ok, so, some people may like that. It's not medium, though, right?  So I put it in the oven for 7 minutes, and I took this picture AFTER those 7 minutes. ...it's still real dark red. I'm certain they didn't even put my steak on a cooking surface. Maybe they spray painted the outside of it to make it look decently cooked. (Kidding, of course.)\n\nThis isn't the first time this has happened. I ordered a med rare from there once, the steak came out barely brown on the outside and purple and bleeding on the inside. Our waitress very kindly offered to fix it, but then the manager came out and argued with my husband and I about how we need to learn what a med rare steak looks like. =/"

b'Saw a deal for $4- steak dinners to go at Chili's so gave late night dinner a go. Ordered us 2, 10 ounce sirloins on their website. Surprisingly, 5 minutes later received my email confirmation at the low price.

Drove 2 miles to Chile's where Dinner's ready and waiting to go. Cashier saw the price on the store computer and my confirmation - got her manager - and I was sent away hungry... unwilling to shell out $34- for the just before bed calories.

Probably a better deal NOT to eat late anyway. But no one said "Sorry about that." or anything. As I was leaving the manager was unhappy the meals had actually been made. That's exactly what he said to his staff in the empty restaurant, "so the dinners were actually made?"

Hope they didn't throw them away...'

b"Chilis has always been one of my favorite places. Tonight, I decided to take my grandmother and my great-grandmother out to dinner (location in Silsbee, TX), since I don't see them often. Not only was the service extremely poor, but the waitress spilled an entire container of ranch all over my shirt and pants. To make matters worse, no offer was made to make this right. WE had to ask. And then, she said the 'best' they could do was offer a few $5 coupons. They did not even add up to what my meal alone cost me.\n\nPlease make this right, Chilis, or you just lost yourself a loyal customer."

b'Visited Chili\'s tonight and ordered the cheese fries. The waiter placed the "hot" skillet right in front of my 18 month old son, warning us the platter was hot. I quickly reached to move the skillet before my son touched it and burned my fingers. Thank God it was me and not him. A mere "plate is hot" warning does not suffice when you bring a SCALDING cast iron skillet to the table straight from a 400 degree oven. Taking away the skillet pot holders is not only short sighted but grossly irresponsible.'

b"Children sleep anywhere 
Anytime, night or day.
It's hard to keep your eyes open
When your job is to play.

While they sleep, parents whisper
About parent things,
But mostly parents wonder
About what their child dreams.

So set the plates quietly
And bring dessert just for one.
Dreams shouldn't be interrupted - 
They'll decide when they're done.

Our table, your pillow?
It's not so absurd.
Sleep and dream little child.
We won't say a word."

b'To anyone that enjoys eating at your local Chili\'s restaurant...Chili\'s has rolled out a new and "convenient" payment processing tablet that is placed at each table.  You can use these things to pay your bill, play games or to notify the server you need something; the servers said they are supposed to encourage customers to use them. Tonight was my first experience with this device and everything seemed okay, at first. I swiped my debit card to pay for the check and began using the handy tip calculator.  As you slide your finger the tip amount increases and automatically adjusts your total. Pretty cool huh?...Until you check the math on the tip percentage. It was off by about $1.75. I brought it to the manager\'s attention and he took a picture with his phone and told me he would advise the corporate office. I\'m not sure if it needs a software update or a redesign, but THIS is definitely messed up.  The picture speaks for itself...By the way, the overage multiplied by an estimate of 200 checks per day comes out to $350, or around $10,000 per month, or about $100,000 per year...And that\'s just one of 1,279 stores nationwide.  Those numbers are staggering.  Please pay, or at least, tip in cash.'

b'I posted a picture of my dinner a few days ago, because after ordering the "original chicken tenders" I was sadly disappointed to have gotten 5 greasy and soggy pieces of batter with a little pieces of chicken in the middle. Disappointing meal experience and poor customer service. Very sad. I use to love going to Chilli\'s with my family. b"So far this is the only rant I have ever and will ever post. If you order food from a restaurant they need to get it right the first time and every time after. It seems that the chilies on Denton highway has to make every mistake every single time that they did not make previously. Well done means no pink all the way through. No ketchup, tomatoes, and onions. mustard only with lettuce and pickles means just that. Every time I order I get a rare hamburger with mustard and mayonnaise and they decide to put whatever other side they want on there. And we been there I'd say a total of about 10+ times in the past two months. Since our info is saved from every time we have previously ordered and the fact that we had to pull the manager aside to let him know his cooks and waitresses and waiters and the people on the phone do not know what they are doing. You'd think they'd at least treat someone, who has previously caused problems for that store because we've had to pull the manager aside, with importance. And that's just my order a simple bacon burger with mustard pickles and lettuce only. Two of the 10+ times the fries were nice warm and fresh every other time they were dry crusted and under the heat lamp for at least three hours. I know this because I used to work in a fast food industry. heat lamps are not good for keeping things warm they're only good for dehydrating all the items. #Chilisdentonhywy . Below is my WELL DONE burger."

status_message: b"We went to chili's on E Fowler Tampa and it was one of the most disappointing casual dining experiences we ever had. I'll get right to the point. The table was dirty, the floor was dirty, my seat was dirty. They tried to seat me and my boyfriend there and I had to tell them to please wipe the chairs and the table. It was wiped with a smelly wet cloth. Then I had to request napkins to dry them off. Then I had to request silverwear. After 20 min the waitress finally came over; we ordered, she never asked how we wanted our burgers cooked. We ordered different burgers but she brought the wrong food. This is the dirty fork that they gave me, I requested another and the new one she brought me smell like spittle. Waitress never came back to check on us. We will never go back. The only person I'd send there is my worst enemy. We still left a 20% tip because my guess is this server will not have a job for long. This place lacks proper management."

b"Hey, Chili's!! I'm at the Traders Pointe location in Indianapolis, Indiana. I tried to pull up a menu online but apparently that impossible until you enter your zip code and pick a location. Then do you get to see the menu? Nope, you have to choose what type of order you want to place. What? I just to see a menu; not happening. I have to commit to an order to view the menu. After all that hassle, I actually arrived at this location I could get a chance to peruse options. So I pulled into a TO GO spot (I am the only car out here) and waited. Three servers have come to the door but no one has come outside. I am parked out here with my headlights off (so as not to disrupt the patrons in the window) but with my parking and fog lights on. After sixteen minutes of waiting out here all by myself, let me just tell you (in case you haven't figured it out already), you just lost a customer. Shame on you!"

b"I was just at your chilies location in Oviedo, and the service was terrible. We waited an hour for a few salads, we drank so much ice tea and ate so much chips that we lost our appetite. When requesting for the manager to come discuss the situation with us he never showed up. Let's just say I am never coming back here again. Also you might want to suggest they clean the tables and seats better than they are currently doing."

b"I can tell you a story... I am super upset, annoyed, frustrated and irritated. Tonight my family of 6 decided to go to chili's for dinner, only to wait 40 minutes. I get waiting. It happens. However let me tell you about my complete experience. Our waitress Jessica (Orlando, Florida Mall location) was phenomenal! She had superb customer service. Jessica anticipated our requests before we even could have thought about what we may have needed, kept us smiling and the family laughing. If my customer experience was based solely on Jessica, I probably would not even be taking to Facebook. Unfortunately my customer experience is not based on just my waitress it is based on how the food tastes, smells and is presented. My experience also includes how clean the environment is and this is where my trip for dinner gets horrible. 

I get my drink. A cold class of pop only to discover that there is lettuce on the side of my cup. (As my husband said later: this should have given us a clue!) I grab a chip and some salsa, as everyone does right! Well I drip some on my shirt. Having no extra napkins on my table I ask my husband to give me one of the 6 rolled up fork and knife sets on the table. I open the first one, there is water spots. Not really a huge deal. BUT!!!! I flip it over and have a few pieces of someone else's dinner on my fork. I ask him to hand me another one (2nd set) open it only to find more food on the fork. I throw it down and ask again for another set (3rd). I proceed to open it and guess what!!!! The napkin was used previously!!!! How gross!!! Now upset I ask for another set (4th)... Yep you guessed it my knife had dried prices of napkin stick to it. Along with someone else's food (more food!!!!!) I am pissed at the moment, but still need to wipe off my shirt. So I again ask my husband for another set (5th). He hands it to me and I open it..... Five! Five sets I had to go trough only to locate ANOTHER SET of dirty, gross and disgusting food on the fork and knife. The knife was so caked with food, that had obviously been washed since it was rock hard that I thought I order a small brownish-black cake!!!!!!!!

I get up and go to the hostess, show her my pile or collection of knifes and forks an request to speak to the manager. She tries to take the sets from me. Yes take them. I pull away and was like no I'll keep these. 

I talk with the first manager. This is how it goes. Oh my that is gross. We were short handed this afternoon and someone roll the forks who doesn't normally do it. Really so your telling me that no one saw this???? I find that hard to believe she proceeds to tell me that she will take them and speak to her other manager. Again she tries to take them just like the the previous person. 

The next manger comes out.. I show her and tell her my experience with the disgusting forks and knifes. She says oh yes that is unacceptable. These should have never been rolled. She continues with telling me that they were short staffed and they had a SERVER roll these earlier today!!! So basically your telling me that a SEVER rolled these. That makes my experience so much better!!!!! She then tells me that she will take care of my meal and get me new forks and knives from the back. I said thank you and no thanks to the fork and knife. 

I educated my server on the situation as I completely bypassed her originally. She says oh my goodness that horrible and should have never made it to the floor. She leaves and comes back with our food. I at this time was not sure if I was going to eat. She asks and brings me plastic ware to eat. (Which I could only eat a few bites as I was at this point sick to my stomach) she also tells me that the manager said she was taking care of our meal. I was satisfied for the most part and dealing with the situation. 

At a later part of the dinner I stepped out and again my husband was told the meal would be taken care of. 

At the end of our meal we were asked if we wanted desert by Jessica. She said the manager said it was on her. Cheesecake was our pick, yummy! After Jessica leaves the manager comes back to the table and says I wanted to give you something sweet to finish your night here and hands me a bill. She explains that she took off   50% and the rest we are responsible for. I guess I heard wrong when I was told our meals would be taken care of. To make it even better after Jessica brings us our dessert and says her goodbyes, I raise the bill and an electronic gift card to pay for it and I receive a dumbfounded face from her. She walks over and I hand her the bill and my gift card she says oh I thought she said your meal was taken care of. I took my apron off so I have to find a pen. 

So now I paid $20 for a $40 meal that I thought was going to be taken care of. 

How would you rate this experience? Well let's just say that chili's USED to be my favorite restaurant!!!! Now I am not even sure if I want to go back. Knowing the background of who rolled my utensils and how they even thought it was a okay to continue rolling them to give to customers... 

Thanks for reading! This is one pissed off customer!!!!!!!!"
link_name: b'The Iceland Seafood International Corporate Website'

b"This is how our food was presented after 54min after ordering.  Needless to say cold would be an understatement at this point where the integrity of the overall consistency is lacking.  Should I have worn dentures I may like my crispers to be similar to the mashed potatos but unfortunately for Gosford Bakersfield I have a full set of natural teeth.  They took away my purple steak before I could get a picture however this was not the first purple steak of the night.  A table not far also had this situation.  My favorite was when the manager argued with my husband that it wasn't an hour it was in fact 54min exactly from which the order was taken to the time it hit the table.  We are very understanding people and should he apologized and taken responsibility for the actions of this location we would have not been upset.  We did not eat one bite but still paid for drinks... Which might I add were jot refilled with in this 54min time.  I would also like to state there was no wait... This was not a busy time and they did not appear in anyway to be short staffed.  I do not care to hear your excuses as to why you waisted out date night together or why I am now eating fast food as all the other options have closed.  I paid my bill and was blamed for this terrible experience after my 10 hour work day.  We just wanted a nice night together and you have taken that and replaced it with a far bitter taste that will linger indefinitely.  Please excuse any grammatical errors as I am beyond frustrated and tired I am sure you get the gist of my protest.  This is Earl O'Dell's wife my phone died while waiting for dinner... For obvious reasons. \nThank you\n Ash Lynn"

So I'm fishing out whatever maybe in this chewed up mess of food in my mouth and I pull out  the object of my pain pictured above. b'My husband and I went out for dinner last night (Veteran's Day) and decided on Chili's (Turlock, CA). When we walked in the door, there was a banner thanking veterans for their service (which I really appreciated).  However, this was the least of out pleasant surprises.

We chose to sit in the bar area (open seating and there was a nice corner booth available), and as customary, I folded and sat my flight jacket on one end of the seat.

Our server (Shawn) greeted us promptly and took our drink order.  When he returned with our drinks, he also presented me with a special "Veteran's Day" menu.

I want to extend my gratitude for Chili's recognition of my service. I've been a veteran (USAF) for 38 years, and this is the FIRST time I've been honored in such a manner.  Words alone can not express how wonderful this made me feel -- particularly in stark contrast to the treatment my brothers-in-arms and I received during and for years after "our war" (Viet Nam).

We all served with pride, and we continue to honor our oath to serve, regardless of whether we are active duty, reserve, separated, or retired.

Thank you Chili's for honoring us!!  ... and my personal thanks to every other veteran, reservist, and active duty soldier, sailor, or airman for your service to our great nation.'
b"I always have such high hopes for Chili's but their To-Go servic always disappoints. This just looks disgusting."

b'What can you expect when you dine at Chili\xe2\x80\x99s? Hear our Chief Operating Officer, Kelli Valade, talk about our commitments to team culture and fresh food. And hear how they add up to a great experience for you.'

b"Today was suppose to be a great day at Chilli's but it went for the worst. I had dinner with my husband for Veterans Day in Monrovia, Ca but a water spill underneath our table caused my foot to collide with the table leg, which broke my big toe nail, bruise my second toe, and I have have a radiating pain throughout my foot because of the impact! We walked out with $50 bill that we didn't even get a receipt for by the way. In addition, I had to limp barefoot while holding my baby because my husband is a disabled veteran and was unable to carry him to the car. And for all of our trouble, we simply received an apology, bandages, and a $50 check--no one even bothered to write an incident report and take our information. If this is the type of service you train for I will never ever dine here again! BTW, should I send you my hospital bill?"

b'Thanks chilis for our free dinner tonight!!! We actually got out bill balance at 00.00 dollars!!!!! 2 happy veterans and 2 kids!!!!! I wanna say thank you to trey our server in carbondale Illinois for making our family feel extra special today! He was an amazing server!!!! USMC COMBAT VETERAN! !!!!'

b"Thank you for the service today! I appreciated the meal and time I was able to enjoy with my daughter as well as being able to thank all the veterans in the restaurant whom have served before. This means a lot to me. Can't wait till next year!"

b'My husband & I VERY rarely go out to dinner. For us, just the gas spent on going out is a big deal. After being seated at Chili's in Manteca, CA, we waited 47 minutes for our meals to be served. Guests who were seated 10 & 15 minutes AFTER us have received their appraisers AND meals. There were 3 children with us. THREE. Three children waiting for 47 minutes to eat. Luckily there was a never ending flow of chips & salsa plus tablets to keep them busy.

After our food arrived I went to find the manager. I showed him my Facebook status that had been posted when we were originally being seated and told him that "our food has just been served, which is great, but I'd like to know why it's taken 47 minutes." He apologized and said "I'll take some of your food off the bill". Arriving back at my table, i found my soft taco was soggy on the bottom & hard on the edges, and the rest of my food appeared old. Fries were stale, burgers were soggy, lettuce & tomatoes weren't "crisp"... I don't know if they were waiting for the rest of the tables food or what the reasoning was, but it was obvious that our plates had been under the heat lamp for a while. This bothered me even more, but I'm diabetic & at this point I was already shaking and nauseated. I wasn't willing to wait any longer for food to be re-made. After eating, we received our bills. My husband & I had a bill for $32.39 and were "comped" $7.61. My sister in law who had 3 children in her party had a bill of $68.87 and were "comped" $2.54.

ARE YOU SERIOUS???

I'm not one who looks for freebies but REALLY you could have given a better effort at keeping us as customers. Thank GOODNESS my sister in law found a groupon that took $12 off their bill!  #CustomerServiceFail #ManagementFail #MantecaChilisFail #IWantMyMoneyBack  #ChefRamseyWouldntStandForIt'

b'Look at this presentation first off.

My food that i refused to even touch..was obviously nuked and died in the hot window.

Beans were so dry that they went back to a dehydrated state!!! Along with my rice...that was obviously portioned and bagged..microwaved and dumped on my plate along with the enchiladas that were nuked amd put in a salamander to melt possibly..or maybe they also died under a heatlamp since they were basically rolled tacos!!!

Im a chef...and throughy many years of cooking..i have NEVER ever..let a plate like this leave the kitchen. It wouldve never made it to the window...if it did..then not past the expo....but somehow this was even acceptable for a server to agree to serve!!!

THIS IS A PERFECT EXAMPLE OF WHY I NEVER FREQUENT CORPORATE FRANCHISE RESTURANTS!!!  

and of course the usual manager coming to tje table to see what tjey could do to adjust the problem was utilized.

But why on earth would i want to try something else or evem remake my meal after being served this garbage!?!?!  

When serving a plate of food to a guest..the presentation amd tastes reflect the pride amd work ethics of that resturant. It trickles back up the ladder.....from servers,expo,cooks,managers,corporate,owners......it also reflects the work put into a dish/plate....which carries into the whole establishment.

Now with that being said...i can only imagine how horrible the kitchen,the walk in storage/freezers/fridges may look like...how sanitary the cutting boards and prep tables may be...or even how the food is prepared..

And from this one dish alone....i can absolutely say from experience...

YOUR COMPANY AS A WHOLE IS A COMPLETE AND UTTERLY FAILURE AND DISGRACE TO ANYONE THAT TAKES PRIDE IN BEING A COOK/CHEF OR HOSPITALITY INDUSTRY ITSELF!!!'

b'My husband and I ate at your Woodridge IL location on Saturday. It was our first and last time eating at Chili\'s. They undercooked our appetizer sliders, they were completely pink on the inside. The manager brought us new ones. Then I get my fajitas and THIS was my steak!!!! How on earth are you serving RAW meat to customers?! The manager didn\'t seem to care very much either, explaining to us "that\'s how I like my meat." I honestly don\'t care how you like your meat, If I eat red meat I get sick. They brought out the \'replacement\' steak which was rubbery and tasted absolutely horrible. No one cared, we never received any type of discount for our constant trouble. I left feeling sick to my stomache. We are very, very dissatisfied and don\'t mind sharing our experience with others.'

My co worker just had fajitas from your restaurant last week and said he got almost triple what I received. Something has to be done to address this. b"So I took my wife and niece to our local Chili's today for lunch and had a pretty sad experience. Service was poor but I can't necessary put that on the waitress because she was working the whole bar area alone. It took a while to get  3 sodas and the food took over 30 minutes to show up (pretty sure speed of service goals for a casual dining restaurant is in the 12-15 minute range). I shared my disappointment with the speed of the kitchen and the waitress was very nice but said they only have 1 guy working back there this time of day. Apparently saving on labor is more important than guest service and satisfaction. That said, I can appreciate the need to balance labor to half hour sales but call in help if you need it. When the food arrives it's lukewarm at best and the limes on top of our Margarita Chicken (see pic) has clearly not been stored or held according to food safety standards. Once I saw how slow things were running and how old the limes were my concerns around other short cuts became even greater so I think it's important for your guests to know their health may be at risk visiting this location. The waitress never asked how everything was to likely avoid an unpleasant answer. I never saw the manager so who knows where they were. 

We've had issues here in the past but it just seems to happen over and over again. I've shared feedback verbally in the restaurant, on the survey machine at the table, and through the online survey with seemingly no improvement so I thought I would try your Facebook page. I know you can just remove the post and pretend the issue doesn't exist but that won't make it better. Chances are many people have experienced the same thing here and just haven't said anything which means you can't address the issue. 

I'm not looking for a free meal, just a better experience for the next person that walks through the door. The new signs and decor look great but the poor guest experience is going to make all the upgrades pointless."

b"Dear Management Team,

I would like to share my dining experience tonight at Chili's 1 Utama in Malaysia.  We were looking forward to an enjoyable meal in your restaurant as I will be away for some times with my family however what has happened was utterly disgusted.  During our meals, we have been attended by a very rude and unprofessional Outlet Manager named Rosie.

First of all, we are a group of 5 with my mum which she is a vegan.  After looking at the menu, we found out that your restaurant does not cater any vegetarian/vegan dishes.  As the waiter approached us to take our order, we enquired if the kitchen could make us a salad for my mum, and he answered 'NO' as all they can offer is within the menu.  So that's fine for us, we still remain to dine in.  However, as for my mum, we have to look around to get her dinner and bring it in your restaurant (not knowing a signage of NO OUTSIDE FOOD).  

While all of us having our meals, Rosie approached our table requesting my mum to take away her food as she explained NO OUTSIDE FOOD ALLOW.  Then I explained to her that my mum is a vegan and that there's nothing that you can offered.  And she replied, though you can't have your food here and please keep it away.  I felt shocked with her answer and asked if my mum could just finish her meal and refused rudely by Rosie claiming that if she has not seen her eating that's fine.  We have never been to any restaurant that has such a poor customer service that cannot even try to be understanding and accommodate a customer for this reason.

This has ruined our entire dinner and we had to quit our dinner and asked for the bill.  Then we had to asked someone in charged to deal with our matter.  The restaurant manager came to us and apologised but why not the Outlet Manager who has fault at first and also who is the senior person during the operation.

Not to mention, your food quality's is not up to a standard of a global steakhouse chain restaurant (please refer to attached photos)."

b"I would like to say how disappointed I am in your Danvers MA location. I have been going there for several years and have been disappointed the last couple of trips. This location is the most poorly managed restaurant I have ever been too and the sad thing is it never used to be this way. 

Today like the last two times I dined there we arrived to a 20-25 minute wait with less than half the restaurant full (see attached pictures). I watched two groups walk out while we waited. One large party and party of three. 

Morale among staff seems extremely low and I am willing to guess there is high turnover. While our waitress Lisa was great and extremely nice she was extremely over worked and often busy. The whole staff there just seems like they need a little leadership. I mentioned the poor management to two employees and both of there responses were \xe2\x80\x9cI agree\xe2\x80\x9d. You would think if I complained to two employees a manager or supervisor would come over but no such luck.

I was give the business card of General Manager Richard Jean. I strongly recommend that someone from your corporate office at Mr. Jean's management or this location will not succeed. This is the first time I have ever complained about a restaurant to their corporate office but this is a true disappoint of a once great location."

b"Dear Chili's you should just close this location (Miami Gardens) down. I don't care when I come here morning, noon or night I NEVER HAVE A GOOD EXPERIENCE. Even when I order to go from here it's an issue. I'm not a picky person. I have truly given up on having excellent customer service when I come to these type of establishments because I know that employment here is a heavily revolving door and it's just not cost effective to take the time to train your hostesses and servers on what service with a smile means. I'm usually good with being seated and having my order brought to me in a timely manner and how it's described on the menu. However this Chili's can't even do that. Upon entering this particular Chili's the hostess directed us to sit in the bar area. I asked to sit on the opposite side because of my previous experience from sitting in the bar area with one particular server. However the hostess obviously had a problem with that because she rolled her eyes at my request! My sever came over and took our orders. I order the lunch combo with the house salad and California Club (which is pictured below) I received the sandwich and about five minutes later they brought the salad. The menu describes the sandwich as being served on wheat Texas toast. When I asked I was told they didn't have anymore Texas toast. At no point did anyone ask me if I wanted something else or informed me there wasn't anymore Texas toast. I really couldn't care any less about the food but having to endure poor customer service because of poor management has gone long enough. I literally live 3 minutes away from this location but avoid going here at ALL COST! Get it together!"

b"I know I have high standards for customer service - but this is defiantly one for the books! Our table of 6 waited at Chili's for over 40 mins to celebrate Father's Day with my dad and husband. During our wait we watched table after table be seated before us. We saw approximately 8 dirty tables and a full bar not being cleaned. We then saw a waiter drop this on the floor and no one clean it for over 20 mins. When we asked how long until we are seated, the waiter rudely said to the hostess, 'oh, this lovely table' and pointed to us. She laughed and replied, 'yes.' She looked at us with a smirk and asked if we still wanted a highchair for our 2-yr-old. I said, 'no, I want to see a manager.' She laughed and went to clean a table. She returned and said the table was ready do I still want a highchair. Again, I demanded to see a manager. She rolled her eyes and returned with him. I explained to him that I specialize in customer service and was disgusted with the treatment we were receiving from his staff and by the horrible state of the restaurant. He claims that he trained them well but I spent 30+ mins listening to his staff chitchat about their boy problems and pretend to clean rather than flip tables and welcome guests. He apologized but we could tell he didn't realize that he was loosing a large ticket and tip for a holiday celebration. He looked scared rather than concerned by our complaints. Not sure he is ready to be a manager of a chain restaurant."

b"Had a good lunch today at your Stafford, VA location.  I got the fajitas with the steak and chicken, which I paid more for.  There was maybe 6 small slices of steak.  For almost $16!  Wow.  I did enjoy my lunch, as long as I didn't use all the 'fresh fixins'.  Why?  My cheese was not fresh, it was hard and sweaty, so it had been sitting out, uncovered.  I only used the pico and salsa.  The food tasted fine.  That's not an issue, but for the amount, and charging extra, it's ridiculous.  Glad to see that you're finally doing tableside guacamole.  I have had the lunch fajitas before, and I had almost the same amount of meat with this full sized order!  You still have the best chips around!!"

b"Chili's is committed to giving back to the communities in which our guests live and work through local and national Give Back Events. While we remain committed to supporting the children and families affected by autism, we are canceling Monday's Give Back Event based on the feedback we heard from our guests.\n\nWe believe autism awareness continues to be an important cause to our guests and team members, and we will find another way to support this worthy effort in the future with again our sole intention being to help families affected by autism. At Chili's, we want to make every guest feel special and we thank all of our loyal guests for your thoughtful questions and comments."

b"At Chili\xe2\x80\x99s Grill & Bar, we\xe2\x80\x99re about making every guest feel special and pride ourselves in giving back to our communities. When choosing a charitable partner for our Give Back Events, both locally and nationally, we are committed to supporting organizations dedicated to helping children and their families.\n \nThe intent of our 4/7 National Give Back Event is not to express a view on this matter, but rather to support the families affected by autism. Our choice to partner with the National Autism Association was based on the percentage of donations that would go directly to providing financial assistance to families and supporting programs that aid the development and safety of children with autism. We sincerely appreciate all of the feedback we've heard on this topic."

b"Yesterday my husband and I had dinner at your Chili's location in Port St. Lucie, FL off of Peacock blvd. Recently I guess you guys installed tablets on the tables to pay your bill... my husband works in IT security and his concern was what is stopping people from just taking the tablet off the table and then they have our credit card store on that thing somewhere... sounds like a security nightmare.... \nAnyways, my real concern was I was playing the apps on the tablet and I noticed my bill had a charge on it for the app.. how ridiculous... when you start playing the apps it doesn't say anything about being charged for them... not to mention... I have a cell phone... with those apps or other ones that I can play... granted I get it is only $0.99 but if you weasel $0.99 out of half the people that go in to that chili's every night.. I am sure you will end up with quite a bit of extra money... really shady chili's... really shady"

status_message: b"I am a bartender at the Chili's in Glenwood Springs, CO. Last night I had a customer who touched my heart and I want to share this story with as many as possible. The guy ordered a draft beer and a bottle beer and asked for a napkin and a pen. I did not notice the bottle of beer and what the napkin said until he left, it brought me to tears. Please share and pay respect to his fallen brothers, my hope is this somehow gets back to him and he knows how much we all appreciate and respect him and all the members of the military who sacrifice so much for us. RIP to his fallen brothers. Thank you all for your sacrifice."

b"This is the kind of quality food and service we received last night from the Chili's in Plainview, Texas. b"Dear Chili's, a bit ago my daughter and I visited your Sulphur Springs, TX location. She loves avocados and when I gave her the menu with the options she immediately choose this. I figured she would and I was interested to try it too. Unfortunately the bottom picture is what we received. Note the lack of full avocado slices and large chicken chunks pictured in the top picture which was what was in your menu. I asked the waitress to please bring me some more avocado for my daughter, as the picture shows slices, and more than one, and clearly we got one slice at best chopped up into small pieces. Which she kindly did. But then she charged me for it!!! When, in my opinion it should have been includedin the price of what I had already gotten because I purchased what was in the top picture. This is something you guys should review. If you're only going to give one slice of avocado cut up into tiny chunks, don't advertise several full slices of avocado then charge customers extra when they ask for what was pictured in the menu. My daughter really wanted the avocados. She's too young to understand false advertisement. Poor business tactics!"
b"It's Happy Hour Roulette time! Press 'Pause' to see which delicious drink you deserve after work tonight. \n\nWhat will you be drinking?"

b"Hey Chili's! I just had the new Margarita Chicken Fresh Mex Bowl at my local Chili's in Saint Cloud, FL. It was fantastic. However, I had a brainstorm idea for presenting our favorite dessert - the Molten Chocolate Cake. 

USE THE BOWL INSTEAD OF THE PLATE!

Our server accommodated my request (with extra chocolate sauce, of course) as seen in the photo.

It not only looks awesome, but gravity takes hold while eating and brings the chocolatey goodness back down to the center where all the action is instead of being lonely spread across the entire plate."

b"I just wanted to share my most recent experience at a Chili's, in El Paso, Texas. I don't eat at Chili's very often, but decided to take the family out there for dinner, at their bidding. I've only been to this particular one once, to enjoy drinks at the bar. After watching a roach crawl across the bar top, I didn't return for years. But convinced by my family to give it another shot, combined with a positive food experience at a chilis on another side of town, I gave in. \n\nRed flags came up immediately, when someone dropped off our appetizers and a stack of small, wet plates. The server immediately looked down, and noticed food still on one, then proceeded to snatch it up and return it to the kitchen. Then, returning with a supposedly clean replacement. (Picture below.) Obviously the plates were just rinsed, and not even thoroughly, as they had food residue clearly visible, and still wet, on the plates. My husband asked me not to make a big deal of it, so as to not startle the kids. So we ate the fried cheese without the plates. After a few bites, nobody wanted theirs, though, because instead of being stringy, flavorful cheese, they were mushy, and wet. (Like the consistency of mashed potatoes.) I'm not even sure how they managed to screw up cheese sticks, but they did. Moving on. My son's entree arrived, which was a corn dog and fries. He was very disappointed to find that it only came with literally 5 French fries. Not a great deal for the $4.99 price tag, if you ask me. I should've taken a picture, but he'd already started eating them before I could. To make matters worse, and I mean MUCH worse, upon taking my daughter to the restroom, we entered the bathroom to hear someone vomiting. I opened the stall door, just in time to witness a female staff member walking out of the restroom, after having vomited, without washing her hands. I was absolutely disgusted to know that this person was handling food/dishe. Because of that, I wasn't very shocked when my son and I both got sick from our meals that night (although, thankfully, my husband and daughter didn't.) I am appalled at the practices taking place at this locale, and will be spreading the word. I will absolutely not be frequenting this facility anymore, and will recommend that others stay away as well."

b"Hey, Chili's! First of all, your chicken enchilada soup is the single greatest thing. Second, I'm a part of an improv troupe in Iowa City, IA called Paperback Rhino. We're all Hawkeyes at the University of Iowa and this coming weekend we're going to compete in Chicago at the National College Improv Tournament. Every semester, we make an effort to take a group trip to the Chili's in Coralville. Last night, we did just that and, like always, we had a great time. I just wanted to share with you our thanks for the excellent service, the tasty food, and the multitude of laughs. We really appreciate it.

Much love,
PAPERBACK RHINO"

b'Chilis, you are celebrating and rewarding a criminal! This man is a fraud. On the morning of October 11 2013 while I was driving my three children ages 7 6 and 4 to school at 8 am this man veered into my lane and hit me head on. My children all suffered neck abrasions, stomach pains and severe post traumatic syndrome. I hit the steering wheel cut my head open Injured my shoulder and burns all over my legs. The concussion headaches lasted for months. You mean to tell me that this man hits me HEAD ON was driving with a suspended license and no insurance and he gets a handout from you guys? I have a police report and I am posting it as we\'ll. when I spoke to Hammond louisiana chilis manager named Michelle she specifically said "we are not the law and there are always two sides to every story". My children and I were cut out of my vehicle, can you image seeing three little girls in school uniforms with blood tied down to spine boards? Can you imagine having all 4 of us in different ambulances and different hospital rooms? My family has suffered enough! My husband is stationed at Eglin Air Force base 4 hours away from his wife and kids. Can you imagine the agony my husband suffered making that drive to us? Or is it because I am an Arabic woman that you won\'t look twice at this? You are celebrating a fraud. A criminal! You are condoning his negligent and criminal behavior! I demand this event be cancelled!  Do the right thing!'

b"My family and I just had lunch at Chili's in Dothan. It was awesome!!  Thank you to Mallory our server, the General Manager, and whole Chili's staff for making Cody feel so welcome!! He has been in remission from B cell Lymphoma since November 18, 2013. The first time we ate there, we had a gift card. It was so great we had to go back!! This time we gave the staff Cody bracelets and they all wore them to support our little warrior. They gave us the following pictures and made him an honorary Chili head:) One of the waiters gave him a rock star pin to go along with his chili pin. As if that wasn't enough, it gets better. We asked for a to go box and Mallory told us the couple who was sitting behind us took care of our meal for us!! I sure wish I knew who they were so we could thank them!! I heard the woman call the young man with her Cody and that got my attention. She told us to have a nice day. I thanked her and said you too.  And they were gone. Thank you all for your random acts of kindness!! It warms my heart that there are still kind people out there!! We ran into so many today alone who have made a big impact on our lives!! It was a pleasure meeting each and everyone of you!!"

b'The Philippine islands were ravished by a typhoon in November, and the country is still dealing with the tragedy. There were many programs that supported the country immediately, but it is important to recognize there are still needs to be fulfilled.

b'A story that was shared today on FB.  My grandgirl's auntie took her to eat at a Chili's in Riverdale, Utah.  I just want the Chili's people to know how AWESOME they are!! <3

Carrie Pringle with Lo Jones and Cameron Pringle

Yesterday we took BrynLeigh to dinner at Chilis in Riverdale.
We had a waiter who seemed very frustrated with BrynLeigh, and B caught on very quickly. We weren't asked if we wanted appetizers, and when he was taking our drink orders, we felt rushed. BrynLeigh asked if they had Cream Soda, and got a firm "No"..and settled on a Diet Coke after about 3 minutes of deciding.

When he came back for food orders, he said, "Ready to order yet?"....we were ready, but BrynLeigh was still looking at her kids menu. She had to circle the one she wanted, and the waiter grew more and more impatient. He rested his arm on a ledge, looked up, looked down. "Hurry" was written all over his face, and BrynLeigh knew she wasn't going fast enough. She finally whispered to her mom "Cheeseburger".
The waiter didn't say a word, instead, he grabbed our orders, and walked off. A waitress who was on her way to another table, came by and asked how our visit was going. I said, "Actually horrible." She kneeled down, and asked us what was going on. I explained the waiters frustrations with BrynLeigh, and she felt terrible. I then explained BrynLeigh is Autistic, and is very thorough. She needs to read all of her options, and takes a while to make decisions. Not just with food.
She immediately went to find the store manager, and we explained again, and she said "I'll get the situation handled."
The waitress came back and asked BrynLeigh if she would like anything else while waiting for her food, and let us know the original waiter we had, was just let go. The manager came back, and let us know, Chili's does NOT put up with the customer service (or lack thereof) that we had with the waiter.
BrynLeigh was so happy with our new waitress, and thought she was gorgeous. lol They were so kind, and completely turned our horrible date night, into a night we would never forget. We are so grateful.
On our way back to the car, we ended up going back inside, so BrynLeigh could get a picture with her new friend, Sterling.

I am writing this today, because I want everyone to remember, that no matter where you work, shop, live, you are going to eventually run into someone who is special needs. BrynLeigh has recently become really sensitive and shy around people, because she has been treated differently so many times. It's like she's protecting herself sometimes. I know she will run into people like this waiter, for the rest of her life, and as long as we are there, she will be protected. But we can't always be with her. So please, be patient. Children (and adults) need your patience, and understanding more than anything. Be friendly. And don't rush them. Even after he was aware of her Autism, there was no apology from him, instead he just stared from a distance, and avoided our table. Except to throw some napkins down. Anytime he passed our table, BrynLeigh ducked behind her mom.
We are so grateful for Sterling, and the store manager. I hope they know how much it meant to us, and to BrynLeigh that our visit was turned around for Bryn.'

b"I was wondering if the tea is supposed to be next to the cleaning supplies? I don't think I will ever eat at Chili's again after the past couple of experiences I have had. I most definitely will never order sweet tea again after looking over and seeing one of the cleaning rags down in one of the pitchers of sweet tea that were being used to give refills. This is a major health violation in my opinion and a great way to lose customers. I would have never noticed it if my tea didn't taste so funny and I didn't see one of the servers cleaning a table and then putting the rags and cleaning spray back in the caddy next to where the sweet tea pitchers were. I also didn't like the fact that our server made it sound like some of the things we got were optional and then charged us for them without telling us that they cost extra or how much extra they were. I didn't find that part out until I got my check. I will not return to Chili's again."

b"One of my family members is currently receiving life-saving chemotherapy at St. Jude's hospital in Memphis. Last month, at age 17, he was diagnosed with Stage 4 Hodgkin's Lymphoma. b'Last weekend we were told that Corporate Office had made the decision that Vaping would not be allowed in Chili\'s restaurants.  This was the reason why we were asked to not vape.  We ate dinner and then left.  We ran into three other vapers who were also told the same thing however they chose to walk out and not eat at your restaurant.  This was one night in one restaurant... makes you wonder how large the impact of vaping is on Chili\'s that Corporate would make a blanket policy at all. Did they make a snap decision that will cost them customers and cash flow in the future? Looks like it.  Nice knowing you Chili\'s. I\'ll find a "vape friendly" restaurant next time.'
link_name: b'New study finds no health concerns in e-cig vapor | American Council on Science and Health (ACSH)'

b"My boyfriend and I took a break from Chili's after being given dirty silverware at the location in New Braunfels, TX, and after today it doesn't look like we will ever go back to a Chili's again. We decided to go to the Chili's in San Marcos, Texas tonight, and we found a bottle cap in our chips. My boyfriend and I didn't want to make a big deal out of it, and were not looking for a discount or a free meal, we were just wanting to know how this happened. We asked for a manager and when he got to our table he accused us of putting the bottle cap in our chips. He was incredibly rude and unprofessional. He did not even apologize! The food was great and the service was great until we spoke to the manager.Finding something that dangerous and disgusting in your food and then being accused of putting it there is inexcusable, and Chili's should be embarrassed to have such an unprofessional employee representing them."

b'I wanted to share my experience last week at Chilis. My 15 year old and I decided to dine in although we were dealing with some emtional issues. My daughter was visably tearing up. We had a very sweet server named Chelsea. She was like heaven sent, very empathetic and very attentive. She obviously sensed we needed a moment and made sure not to intrude in our discussions. She was so kind and patient. She defintely enjoyed her job and you could see it with every expressions she made.  We decided to split and entree\' and order dessert. As she brought our dessert, she mentioned this to us that when her family has dessert, that they must say two things they are thankful for first. She started it off and said she was thankful for having the opportunity to have a great job, and also said she was grateful for such a beautiful day. Then my daughter said what she was thankful for. It made my day to hear my daughter say she was thankful to have me in her life, considering my cheesy thankful remark was, that I was thankful for the delicious dessert. I was very pleased with my experience and Chelsea brightened our day. I left her a tip to express my thanks, and left a card that said "No act of kindness, no matter how small is ever wasted." -Aeso "Paying if forward one day at a time".\r\nWhat\'s ironic... is that this transaction never debited my account, inquiring minds wonder. What an amazing experience. Will be back for sure. :)'

b"This is just horrifying. You can't simply tell us that you are conducting an internal investigation just to put us at ease. She needs to be terminated. If you look at her page, she is still working there, and still complaining about working there. She is also complaining about people not leaving her big enough tips. Who is to say that she won't take her anger out on her next customers if she happens to get a small tip. It seems to me that no one she serves is safe. Surely threatening your customers is ground for immediate termination? This has me questioning the ethics of Chili's. Normally I wouldn't judge a whole franchise over one employee, but the way your company is handeling this has me changing my views."

b"Chili's are exploiting this girl's story to make up for all of the things they do wrong. I'm glad that they made up for this, but then again, Chili's are willing to fix food orders. They have a major problem working with people who get hurt on their property. I badly cut my finger on a staple that was sticking up in one of their menues. It literally ripped layers of skin off my thumb. The remainder of our meal, we were avoided like the plague. The table behind us complained about their appetizers being skimpy and their drinks not having enough alcohol, and they got the royal treatment for the remainder of the evening. All I got was a bandage for my bleeding finger which I had to ask for myself. I would have appreciated an apology, but I never got one from the manager. We did not get refills on our drinks, nor did they come and ask us if everything was ok. I sat and watched as the manager went from table to table, talking to everyone but our party of three. I emailed Chili's headquarters. They asked me to send information about my experience. I sent everything they asked for, but that is where it ended. I have not heard from them since, except the occasions I posted a picture of the skin hanging from my thumb on their Facebook page. CHILI'S IS A BIG JOKE!!! I think I will repost that picture on their page again tonight."
b'The Midvale, UT Yelp page for any interested.'
b"Very cool Chili's, very cool!"
link_name: b"Autistic Girl's 'Broken Cheeseburger' Story Goes Viral"

b'I want to share the experience that my husband, 7 year old autistic sister and I had today at the Chili\xe2\x80\x99s location in Midvale, UT.  Arianna, my little sister, didn\xe2\x80\x99t waste any time when our waitress, Lauren, greeted us at our table.  Arianna promptly ordered her cheeseburger with pickles, french fries, and chocolate milk before Lauren could even take our drink order.  Lauren smiled and told Arianna, \xe2\x80\x9cOkay! I\xe2\x80\x99ll be right back with your chocolate milk!\xe2\x80\x9d.  When we got our food I was wondering why Arianna wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t touch her cheeseburger, but was going to town on her french fries. I asked her, \xe2\x80\x9cArianna are you going to eat your cheeseburger?\xe2\x80\x9d She calmly said, \xe2\x80\x9cNo, I don\xe2\x80\x99t want it.\xe2\x80\x9d Cheeseburgers, or \xe2\x80\x98Krabby Patties\xe2\x80\x99 as we sometimes call them, are her FAVORITE! So this behavior was VERY strange. So I asked her, \xe2\x80\x9cWhy don\xe2\x80\x99t you want it?\xe2\x80\x9d.  She replied, \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s broken. I need another one thats fixed.\xe2\x80\x9d  Then it dawned on me why she wasn\xe2\x80\x99t eating it.  It\xe2\x80\x99s because it was cut in half. Being a child with autism, she has to have certain things in a particular order at all times.  One slight change in her routine can change the course of the day instantly.  When Lauren came back to check on us, I asked if we could order another cheeseburger and just add it to our check.  She had a concerned look on her face so I explained that Arianna has autism, and that in her mind, because the cheeseburger was cut in half, she thinks its broken and can\xe2\x80\x99t eat it. I told Lauren I knew it sounded silly, but if we could just order an additional one we will gladly pay for it because there was nothing wrong with the one that was originally brought out. Lauren was so sweet and just smiled and went along with Arianna, telling her \xe2\x80\x9cI brought you a broken cheeseburger?! You know what, I\xe2\x80\x99ll have them cook you a new one!\xe2\x80\x9d I loved this because rather than just taking it from the table, she actually TOLD Arianna what she was doing.  While this seems insignificant, by her telling Arianna what she was doing, we avoided a melt down.  The manager, Bradley Cottermole, then came to our table, kneeled down, and said to Arianna, \xe2\x80\x9cI heard we gave you a broken cheeseburger!  I am so sorry about that! We are making you a brand new one that isn\xe2\x80\x99t broken, with pickles! I\xe2\x80\x99ll bring you some french fries to munch on while you\xe2\x80\x99re waiting, ok?\xe2\x80\x9d A couple of minutes later, Lauren arrived back at our table with cheeseburger #2.  Arianna said, \xe2\x80\x9cOH FANK YOU! You fixded my cheeseburger!\xe2\x80\x9d When Lauren walked away, Arianna just sat there for a second and looked at her new burger.  She looked like so deep in thought....just staring at it....then she let out a big \xe2\x80\x9dOH I missed you!!\xe2\x80\x9d and started kissing the burger over and over again. I showed Lauren this picture and said, \xe2\x80\x9cI think we glorified the cheeseburger too much!\xe2\x80\x9d She busted up laughing, and asked if she could go show her manager.  She came back a minute later and said she showed everyone in the back kitchen area too, and that it made them all laugh and smile.  I was so touched by this experience.  Especially since I know people who have been asked to leave restaurants when their child with autism is being disruptive.  I expected a few different things with this scenario based on past experiences, but I did NOT expect such kind and compassionate mannerisms from Lauren and Bradley.  Everyone, from the hostess to the chef, played a role in what most people would think isn\xe2\x80\x99t a big deal.  But this entirely shaped how the rest of our day would go.  I know...a cheeseburger cut in half literally could make or break our day.  In this case thanks to the professionalism of the crew in Midvale, it made our day.  And I\xe2\x80\x99m sure Arianna brightened up at least one of the employees days with her silly little personality.  Thank you.'

b'Went to Chili\'s tonight for an early dinner at 4:40, were seated right away, Our Server Randall at the Town East #99 Mesquite Texas location came over 10 minutes later and got our drink order and asked if we were going to get an app. We said no at the time since we were still deciding on a main course and I was telling my husband that my menu was slimy and the dessert section was covered in old/ dried on sauce, he told me to ignore it... 10 minutes later and still no drinks (2 cokes adult and kids and 1 strawberry lemonade) Randall came over and got our order (bacon cheese burger, chicken fajita and a kids burger) 5 minutes later we finally got our drinks and our App took some time to come out as well, we barely started on the App when our food came out... My husband had Mayo on his burger (which mind you my husband didn\'t say anything about it because our other Chili\'s location would always ask if you wanted that on there so he didn\'t even think to mention he was allergic) When my husband said "oh no, it has mayo on it" our server gave an "I\'m not sending it back attitude" until I spoke up and informed him it was due to allergies not preference, then he finally sent it back. I also had food crusted onto my plate (I have a picture) again my husband told me to ignore it since it wasn\'t touching my food and it was on the rim. His burger came back and my drink was empty and staid empty for 20 minutes, he dropped my second lemonade of the night off with the check.... I took one sip of it before seeing ANOTHER HUGE DRIED ON SAUCE SMUDGE on the side of my glass (also took pictures) This time I could not ignore it since it turned my stomach!!!!! After another 10 minutes of waiting for the check to be picked up so I could leave,  I called out to one Manager I saw (Spanish Male) and was ignored twice before getting Emily\'s attention (got her name from my receipt) I showed her my glass, plate, told her about the menu and also the other lady that requested clean spoons for the third time, she said she was sorry and took our check, she told another server to go get Randall and she spoke to him about 4 feet from our table at the server station, Randall passed us two other times and never said a word to us to apologize for the service or the crusty food all over my glass or plate. Emily took my drink and an app off our tab and left it at that... Needless to say I won\'t be back!!!!!!'

b"The bartender is a racist bastard. I used to go here almost once a week to have beers and appetizers. Not anymore. I'm from Mexico and Wednesday Dec 26th 2012, went there with a high school friend that I have not seen in ages. We started talking in Spanish and maybe that was not OK with the bartender. After struggling to have his attention, we ordered a couple of beers, he said: Just this 1 round right? Like he was suggesting it. I said: I don't know, we'll see. When my friend finished his drink, he asked for another one. The bartender blatantly ignored us, not only that, he refilled another costumer and he was not even asking. He even turn his back on us! Literally his back on us. I was mad and ask for the check and left. I'm not coming back there ever. (This Happened in Collierville, TN)"

-Food issue of BURNED food being sent out
-Retouching the burger to remove onion

Towards the begining of the year this happened to my husband and they were in his burger. He actually bit into the ceramic. We are unsure if he swallowed it or not but it sure did tear up his gums. This is extremely unacceptable. And both times we threw a royal fit and they refused to opt the entire meal. They made us pay for my meal, our drinks and appetizer. Management ( the Manager's name is Robin Howe) there is also very rude....extremely rude and needs to learn customer satisfaction. He did not take to there being shards of ceramic plate in food as a problem, he only put on a fake smile and pretended as if he was going to fix the problem. So just a fair warning. If u chose to go to CHILIS check ur food and ur kids food PLEASE!! This Problem will be taken to corporate and possibly the county health department for the area."

b'My wife and I dine at Chilis on a regular basis. On this visit I decided to spurge and ordered a ribeye steak. I had high expectations for the flavor and quality of the flame grilled steak. With this being true I will no longer be ordering steak or chicken at your establishments. And it will be difficult to dine with Chilis at all because those were the items I liked.  Honestly, when I wanted a great steak Chilis was my first choice, and now Chilis is not even on my list for great steaks. The service I received was great and the manager was very nice. Our experience was good but the food was average. I am not looking for compensation, I am voicing my disappointment at Chilis move from flame grilling.'

b'My family I visited the Chili\xe2\x80\x99s in Wichita Falls TX this evening. It wasn\xe2\x80\x99t very busy and they seemed to have plenty of staff. We were seated immediately by one of two hostess\xe2\x80\x99. We waited for over an hour for our food before we finally got fed up and left (our food never showed). During our wait, our server and a \xe2\x80\x9cmanager\xe2\x80\x9d stopped by our table a few times to apologize for the wait. The last time the \xe2\x80\x9cmanager\xe2\x80\x9d stopped by, she said she was going to offer us 1 brownie for our inconvenience. I found out later that this was not even an act of kindness on her part but in fact the deal of the day offered to anyone that accepted it. About 25 minutes after the last apology, our food still had not arrived and we left. After leaving the location, I called the restaurant and asked to speak to a manager. I was put on hold for almost 5 minutes and I hung up and called back. When I asked for a manager, the gentleman that answered informed me that he was the manager. I explained my situation and he told me he had just been informed of what had happened. I asked him why our food never showed up. He explained that the server never actually submitted our order and it had in fact only been submitted AFTER we had left. I got the home office number and plan on calling them Monday. I know I shouldn\xe2\x80\x99t expect superior customer service at Chili\xe2\x80\x99s, but I think it\xe2\x80\x99s fair to expect the food that I order to actually be brought to the table. I doubt that Chili\xe2\x80\x99s will respond to my emails, facebook posts or phone call since they can\xe2\x80\x99t even get a couple of plates of food to the table\xe2\x80\xa6. WORST EXPERIENCE EVER!!!! '

b"I recently visited one of your locations in an LAX airport where everything about this place was absolutely awful. When I tried to complain the manager  Aurtuo C (who refused to give me his name) was upset that I even asked to speak with him. The wait staff was lazy, inconsiderate, and had customers waiting 15 minutes for tables while talking to themselves. b"OMG ... I HAVE to let everyone know about the *outstanding* management and service at the Chili's Restaurant in Marana, Arizona. I've been planning a big send-off/birthday celebration for my son Josh and some of his friends who are deploying to Afghanistan in just a couple of weeks. They first told me that as a corporate policy, Chili's doesn't do reservations, even for large parties of people. I've been staying in weekly contact with them to update them on the size of our group, asking about menu options, drink prices, etc because I've wanted this to go as smooth as possible and for it to be fun as hell for Josh and his friends. Today, for the first time I spoke with the manager who will be on duty for the party night and right away, without hesitation he said nope we don't normally do reservations ... but for the guys who are deploying, we are going to make an exception this time and make this happen so you don't need to worry about the reservation, your tables WILL be ready at 7:00. Also we don't normally give a military discount but we are gonna do one tomorrow night for the guys to show our appreciation. WOWWWWWW ! Thank you Nick, thank you for your support for our military guys, and for helping to make their last get-together before deployment more fun. Chili's in Marana *totally* rocks !! \xe2\x99\xa5"

To top it all off 3 other people are waiting and getting cold food too.  I heard from one of the customers it's not the first time. \nDefinitely my last time!  So many restaurants to choose from!"

b"Hey I do not know if I need to write this here or not. We go to Chili's at least once a month with the children so they get their free meal. I normally go during the week being 7+ mths pregnant I crave Chili's. We normally go to Chili's in Cartersville, GA (they are the greatest). This time was different; way different and it did change my perspective on the way they treated my family and I. We got to Chili's in Rome, GA and we had a party of 6. We sat down because we had 2 children and we waited on the rest of the party to get there. This was at 6:07 p.m. I used the restroom with my daughter and came back. My husband had ordered our waters. Within 5 minutes our server Mike brought out the waters. Around 6:15; We then proceeded to order the queso dip with chips and salsa. He said I will get this order in and bring it back to you. Our company arrived with one extra person. Not a problem since we were sitting at a big table. Our guest arrived at 6:40 pm. (traffic bad cause of an accident is why they were late) (Not one time in 25 minutes did our server stop and ask if we were okay or did he refill my husbands water.) We still did not have our queso dip with 2 small children hungry and me 7+ mths pregnant hungry. Well then our guests ordered there sweet tea and asked for appetizers. I then asked our server did he forget about our appetizer. He then said the kitchen was behind. Not even 5 minutes later our guest had their appetizers and then the server brought out ours. (no later than 6:50 pm)  He then got our our orders. 7 people. Split tickets. Not too hard. So at least our children had something to munch on and eat. Within this time 3 other groups sat in the same area with our server. They were served drinks and appetizers in a timely manner. The 3 groups then got their food before we did. By this time our guest were wondering what is going on, besides my husband and I. We looked and it was 7:24 p.m  (34 minutes since we placed the order) it finally came out around 7:30. During this time. They forgot to bring out our guest his fajitas trio. So we all sat around waiting (except the children) on our guest to get his food. 7:40 p.m. our guest received his food. So by the time we all started eating our food (4 adults) were cold. So we got done about within 10 minutes. Since we sat there almost 1 hr before we received our food. Remember we place the order at 6:50 p.m. We asked for our tickets 2 times before the waiter brought the food and after he did. During this time our guest had already refilled their sweet tea 2 times since the server seemed to think we were invisible. So at 8:00 p.m. we got our ticket and our guest didnt want to take there food home since it took us forever to get it. I then asked the guest why our amount was 21.94 that he already included tip. which brought it to 25.14. I asked the server how come the tip was included. He said you have a big party so we automatically include it. I said on your menus it says a party of 8+ gets gratuity included. I said we have 7 and its also split ticket. I said this was one of the worst services we have ever had so I dont want you getting the tip that is written I will leave the amount you deserve. No one else in our party was going to say something but I do not feel that he had a right to treat us that way. He then said this is ridiculous I cant control the kitchen staff and how they cook the food. He them stormed off with our ticket. This time the other guest we had went and paid their ticket 57.00 and some change while I was waiting for our ticket. I told my husband to take the kids to the car while I waited. About 8:10 ish the manager came over and was like let me take care of the bill. I told him its not a problem we can pay for our food. I just did not appreciate the server. I then told him about the 1 hr and 53 min and told him everything I just written down. Then another server came up and said you dont know his situation but his mother just had a stroke and he has to deal with people like you. The manager did not say anything to her but then I said you dont bring your personal life to work. I can make excuses all day about me being pregnant but I have not. Then she rolled her eyes and stormed off. I am in Culinary School and have taken the hospitality classes and server classes. I have also worked as a waitress for 4 years. I do know how it feels but you can not bring your personal life to work. Paying customers should not have been treated that way. So then we paid for our food and left. I will NOT go eat at Chili's in Rome GA again. We will drive to Cartersville Ga to eat Chili's and this means that the Rome store may not suffer much but I eat there 2 times a week during lunch and they have just lost my business. By the way our server his name was Mike. "

b" Chili's three strikes you're outta here! I will never ever go to your establishment again. Veteran's Appreciation Day my back side! How dare you complement your selves! You are liars. Your staff is rude. We called ahead of time to be sure our local Chili's was doing the Veteran's Appreciation Day. We drove over 25 miles to get to that Chili's then when we asked for the Veteran's special menu we were told they were doing it anymore. I do not like being treated like gutter trash because my father expected a free meal for serving his country not once but TWICE! He was in the Navy and went to Nam in the sixties then in the eighties he was a member of the Army National Guard!
Oh the Chili's I am referring to is the one Located on Albertrains Blvd in Gadsden Alabama! Shame shame on you for your disrespect and bad attitude!

b'Shame on Chili\'s in LaVista NE!  Last night we went to eat at our local Chili\'s, as we were walking in there was a family of 5 getting ready to be seated and one older gentleman, I would say in his late 80\'s early 90\'s.  The manager said something to this older gentleman and he turned and walked back outside.  The family in front of us looked stunned.  Then I heard one of them say, "He\'s a Veteran!" One of the younger gentlemen in the party of 5 went back outside, asked the older gentleman to come back in.  When they were back inside the younger gentleman told the hostess, "Seat this gentleman and send his bill to our table!"  I was stunned!  The manager of the restaurant actually refused this American Hero his Veterans Dinner!  Simply because he arrived a day late for the special!  Come on Chili\'s!!  For shame!  The restaurant was not busy so it wasn\'t like they would have had to make people wait because of him; it probably would have cost you what maybe $2.00 to actually feed him?!?  I applaud the family that had enough respect and patriotism to feed one lone American Hero when a multi-million company wouldn\'t.  It\'s people like that family that make me proud of the country I live in; however the manager, well there was no greater disappointment in a human being then I had for her last night.  I have family all over the states with retired members of the Navy, Coast Guard, Army and the Air Force. Our son is an active duty Airman in the Aif Force and we are so proud of im for carrying on that Veteran\'s legacy in protecting and serving his country. We have all grown up knowing that the military has sacrificed many and fought hard for the very freedoms that I think that manager takes for granted.  We as a family and several friends have decided we will not spend our hard earned money at Chili\'s again. '
