b'I am EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED AND PRETURBED TONIGHT because of my Chili\'s experience in SULPHUR, LOUISIANA. I am a mother with a one year old and seven year old at home. I had a guest over visiting from Texas and we ordered Chili\'s TO GO. I was FINALLY going to try the Chili, which I was totally in the mood for, and couldn\'t believe I had never tried it because I\'ve been to Chili\'s very often. (ALTHOUGH I WILL NEVER BE ORDERING OUT AGAIN). Not only was I disappointed whenever my guest returned with my food and everything was in it, including the salad (I ordered a Chili/salad meal deal), BUT THE CHILI. Yes, I PAID for a CHILI. I have the confirmation of my order in my email account. BUT MY GUEST asked the guy if it was our food after waiting for 30 MINUTES, and whoever was working there checked the bag and the receipt and said it was "all there"---(I don\'t live a hop, skip and jump away, mind you, and I have children that I obviously didn\'t want to take out or I WOULD HAVE)...anyway, my chili was missing, everyone got to eat BUT MYSELF and then we checked the bag for our receipt for a refund for the chili, and THERE WAS NO RECEIPT. I have no receipt, they told me to either go BACK OVER THERE and pick some up (NOT A HOP SKIP AND JUMP AND I\'M A MOTHER WITH CHILDREN THAT CAN\'T GO OUT TONIGHT) OR just come back tomorrow and get a discount? Seriously? You deprived me of my dinner that I ORDERED AND PAID FOR, I have no proof over the phone, so I can\'t go get it, I can\'t get reimbursed for something I DID NOT GET TO ENJOY YET PAID FOR, and I\'M SUPPOSED TO USE THE GAS to go on BACK over there for another 30 minute wait with my children or GO TOMORROW when I CANNOT and "You\'ll remember me?".....get some better, professional etiquette, people, you are a CHAIN, not some mom and pop place. Thank you robbing me of my measley 8 bucks. I know it\'s not a lot to you, but I don\'t get to eat out often, and when I do and PAY for it, I\'d like my steaming bowl of chili as the rest of our order gets to eat....THAT WAS THE POINT. NEVER NEVER NEVER AGAIN, after getting food poisoning from the one in LAKE CHARLES and this incident, you can keep my 8 bucks, and I\'ll keep my consumerism away from the likes of you and anyone else I can tell by word of mouth. SEVERELY DISAPPOINTED.'

b"So I'm gonna just post my experience at the San Angelo TX location and maybe you guys will do something about the issues.
So on November 11, my family and I decide to come to Chili's once more, despite a previous bad experience here thinking it was a fluke, to have some food.
So we first walk in, the hostess is talking loud and obnoxiously to a friend who had walked in to what seem by their conversation (hard not to hear) that she was just hanging out at the entrance till her ride showed so they chit chatted then realized my family and I were standing there for about 2 min till she acknowledged us. She tells her friend hold on I'll be right back, and seats us.
As we are walking I look around and notice the staff just hanging out in the back on their phones. The floors were dirty, and lots of empty glasses.
We sit down and we wait for our waitress whom was I guess apparently busy so a walking by waiter took our drink order. At where I'm sitting I can see in the kitchen, so i can see the waiter arguing with a female I presumed to be our waitress and he begins to take our food order. He takes I decide to go to the restroom and wash my hands, I go in and the bathroom is a mess. Water and trash everywhere I was in and out.
I come back to the table and wait a while till our food comes out. When it does most of the food is cold. Also It is average at best. At this point a third waiter starts to tend to us, and he informed us that our waiter was sick and had left. Great he was handling my food. So we wait for an eternity for our check and we decide that it wasnt a fluke, the bad service is a trend.I hope that you handle this issue and I also suggest THAT NO ONE IN SAN ANGELO RETURN TO CHILIS OF SAN ANGELO the overall performance is terrible."

b"The Chili's in Macon, GA really needs to get their act together for their lunch service. I was there today with 4 co-workers and experienced what might have been the worst lunchtime restaurant service ever.

My 4 co-workers arrived at 11:56am and were promptly seated. I was caught in traffic and arrived at 12:03pm (I know this because they texted me to find out where I was - I was getting out of my car). When I arrived at the table, our first server was taking drink orders. We all placed our drink orders and she left to fill those. Approximately 15 minutes later, we still had no drinks, nor had we seen our server again since placing the order. Finally, we caught the attention of one of the hostesses, who directed the front-of-house manager to our table. She apologized, left the table, and returned with a new server who would then handle our table. He left and immediately returned with our drinks, and took our food order. I ordered a triple-treat sampler, another co-worker ordered a burger, another the soup and salad, and the two others the 2 for $20 special, consisting of cheese fries, one with ribs one with steak. The co-worker who ordered steak asked that the broccoli be substituted with apples. The co-worker who ordered the soup and salad also had your Facebook coupon for a free appetizer. She ordered the cheese sticks.

Approximately 20 minutes later, an expediter brought out the cheese sticks. We finished those around the same time that the manager returned to check on us. We let her know that the two co-workers who had ordered the 2 for $20 had not received their cheese fries. She again apologized and on her way to the kitchen, another expediter brought out the fries. Those were finished when the second server returned to our table, checking on us. By that time three of us needed drink refills, and we informed him that we had now been sitting at the table for nearly 40 minutes and still had not gotten our food. He obviously knew that, but 40 minutes later, it obviously needed to be stated. In the meantime, other tables around us, who had arrived after us and placed their orders after us, had already received their food, some of which included appetizers prior to their meal.

About 5 minutes later, he returned from the kitchen with all of the food, with the exception of the co-worker who ordered the soup and salad. The co-worked with the ribs requested BBQ sauce to go with the ribs, He stated that it was coming right out, though he disappeared for at least 10 minutes. A third server stopped to check on our table, and we informed him that the soup and salad co-worker still had not received her food, the BBQ sauce had not been brought out, and the co-worker with the steak had received broccoli and apples, instead of the mashed potatoes and apples that she had ordered. She left and the manager immediately returned with the third server and the soup and salad, and BBQ sauce. The manager told the soup and salad co-worker that her meal would be comped, as it should have been at that point.

The mashed potatoes came out about 5 minutes later, as we were all finishing up our meals. The second server returned with drink refills around the same time that the masked potatoes came out. I informed the server that I needed to go ahead and settle my check as I had to leave in the next few minutes (I had an appointment about 35 minutes up the road, and assumed that I would have had plenty of time to eat lunch and get out of there to make my appointment when I arrived at 12:03pm). He left to get my check, and returned just a few moments later. I quickly checked my check, handed him my card, and headed to the restroom. I returned just a minute or two later, and found that he had not returned with my check, but was rather delivering food to another table, then left to go to the bar to get a margarita for another table, and then proceeded to the point-of-sale to process my card, as well as print the checks for the rest of my table.

I received my check and card, asked for a pen, but was ignored. One of my co-workers provided a pen, I signed my check, and left. I got back into my car at 1:16pm - that's 1 hour and 13 minutes from the time I arrived for lunch. One of my co-workers called me and informed me that appetizer ordered by the co-worker who had her soup and salad comped, ordered using the Facebook coupon, had been placed onto her bill and she had to argue with the second server about having given him the coupon and eventually had it taken off her bill. She also had the server split the check for the 2 for $20 meal, which took him another 5 minutes and the help of the manager, to accomplish. However, after all of that, he charged both meals to her card. The other co-worker ended up having to pay her back with cash as they had already been there for an hour and 20 minutes at that point, and with an hour lunch break, they were already 30 minutes late and still had a 10 minute drive back to the office. They ended up leaving at 1:18pm, a full hour and 22 minutes after they arrived.

I'm posting this story because whoever is in charge to know that this is unacceptable by all means. If you want lunch business, you have to provide lunch service. An hour and 22 minutes is extremely long even for dinner service (for instance, my wife and I were in and out of Carabba's a couple weeks ago in under 45 minutes, and that included appetizer, salad, entree, and dessert!) I only hope that this is an isolated incident, though it if it is not, you may want to consider discontinuing lunch service at this location."

b'I just want to tell you that as a "regular" person I will always do my best to patronize a Chili\'s before a competitor simply because I have seen 1st hand the contribution your company makes to St. Jude Children\'s Research Hospital.  I want to shout it from the rooftops!  Also, want to add that I have been to many states and have to say that the service at the Jacksonville Arkansas Chili\'s is BY FAR SUPERIOR over other locations.  The Twins are awesome (easy to remember) and so are many of the others and the service is very personal and we leave with a smile.  Before St. Judes became personal, the staff there had a way of touching us as customers without pushing and we would donate never realizing that in time a dear friend would be there with her baby boy Matthew Robert Pierce who recently received his 2nd BMT in the Chili\'s Care Center.  Thank you for your mission with St. Jude!'

b'Customer's need to REMEMBER that your server's (wait staff) work for TIPS.  And for those customer's who think that insulting your server's will make a difference....think again.  Just because you had a bad day with someone....don't take it out on your server with nasty name-calling.

My daughter works for Chili's and a customer called her "stupid" twice and lied to her manager...brought tears to my daughter's eyes.  Thank goodness for other customers who came to my daughter's rescue.  My daughter handled herself with the UPMOST RESPECT, continued to serve this rude customer to the very end of their meal and many other customers with a BEAUTIFUL SMILE and OUTSTANDING SERVICE.

We all need to remember, that if your order is wrong....it many not necessarily be your server's fault.  It may be the person in the KITCHEN preparing your meal.  UNDERSTANDING and kindness goes a long way. NO one is perfect.'

b'I recently took my family to the first Chili\'s on Fort Hood. As a military family we are on a tight budget! However it was my son\'s 7th birthday and after having a terrifying year we figured he desereved something he would remember. We told our waitress that it was my son\'s birthday she informed us that she "got this" so we ordered. When the food was delivered it was wrong. some how they managed to mess up my soup, then forgot the curtons on the salad, they substituted the wrong thing on my husbands food and when they correctly brought him fries they were cold. But we let it go the most important thing was at the end. Which never came. I reminded the waitress by telling her that my son could pick out his present with his money as soon as we boxed the food up and left. Nothing. we got the box from her. nothing. she brought us the check. nothing. we paid the check. nothing. at this point my husband is livid. I am seeing red and we leave no tip and leave. My son was disappointed because other places "sing to you on your birthday" if the waitress would have said that they do not sing on birthdays or we had to purchase a desert to get the singing we would have either left or purchased the desert but she did neither. She was horrible'

b"I am against kids eating free.. WHY??      the cost is asorbed into the cost of the food the adults have to pay for so my wife and I whom are on a fixed income,  Social Security,  has to pay for your kids..... and you might be making over 50,000  joint a year or much, much , much more even..... Go figure.... as much as I love Chili's,, this turns  my wife and I off. "

b'A Few month ago my family and i went to have lunch at the Chili\'s in Mcallen, Tx. My oldest son has Fragile X Syndrome & Mild Autism and my youngest son has fragile x syndrome. They only had 1 section open in the entire restaurant due to lack of servers, so we agreed to sit down in the crowded little area that was open, both my boys were starting to get over stimulated, and their was to much noise, that lead to a complete and total meltdown, everyone just kept on staring at us and making faces, the table behind us even had the nerve to tell us if we could control them and have them sit down because they were disturbing them. my reply was no i can\'t sorry they have fragile x and autism. She just turned around and rolled her eyes like a IGNORANT person would. i didn\'t want my kids to ever go through that so i got up talked to the manager and without hesitation he moved us to a area where no one was sitting it was just myself, my husband and our 2 boys along with all their flapping and clapping :) the manager came to our table and told us never to think we are bad parents, we are doing everything we can to make sure our children are comfortable, and so much more nice things I\'ve never heard anyone else tell me besides my husband. I don\'t know what its like to raise a "normal" child but people complain that its so hard! Try raising a child with special needs. Scratch that try raising 2 kids with disabilities who are non verbal!!'

b'Today a friend and I decided to eat in your restaurant in Southaven, MS.  The whole experience started off bad!  First there was no juice to order for my 1 year old.  All you guys had to offer was milk and soda!  Most parents rely on a restaurant to offer some kind of juice for kids.  Second of all the food was nowhere near as good as it usually is.  It tasted like it was not cooked right!  I am guessing because you guys were under staffed that day.  The hostess was apologizing for this though.  Still I didn\xe2\x80\x99t say nothing because I have worked in restaurants and I know how it is to have a bad day.  So I understand that and I was still planning on coming back to eat there.  We left the restaurant and went to do a couple of other things when I realized that we had left my baby bottle on the table.  And this is the only bottle that she would drink out of.  I had bought several very expensive bottles and she didn\xe2\x80\x99t want to have anything to do with them.  So I called Chili\xe2\x80\x99s to tell them that I was on my way back to pick up the bottle when they inform me that they threw it away!!! WHAT!!! It hadn\xe2\x80\x99t even been 2 hours!  They didn\xe2\x80\x99t even try to hold it to see if I came back to get it, they just threw it away.  Then the employee put the manager on the phone and he was very rude to me and he said that they were not liable for stuff left in their restaurant and when they see stuff left on the table they just throw it away.  He didn\xe2\x80\x99t apologize or anything.  We was very sarcastic and rude!  So I am guessing your telling me if someone leaves their purse on the table you guys are just going to pick it up and throw it away.  Who cares if they may come back for it!!!  Now I am having to listen to my baby cry all night because she doesn\xe2\x80\x99t want to drink out of this other bottle!  I would like to thank you guys for that!!!  And so you know we will never eat there again and I will be posting this on every single website there is that rates restaurants and all my friends on facebook will know that obviously chili\xe2\x80\x99s is not a very family friendly restaurant! '

b"Chili's Grill & Bar is one of our favorite restaurants. We love their 2 for 20. I was craving a steak so I ordered the 2 for 20 online. Rob got here and some reason my food always gets messed up. I called them anyway thinking maybe we could get a gift card. I didn\xe2\x80\x99t want my husband to go back up there. So, I called them. They are not only remaking my order but they are throwing in a free side dish a desert and they are bringing to me. I am in the Vandy Hospital. I am SOOOOO IMPRESSED. They said that was for sure not the steak that I ordered. I was already a fan but I am so impressed. GO EAT AT CHILLI\xe2\x80\x99S . This was the West End restaurant. I understand mistakes happen but this is going above and beyond to fix it."

b'This is the last photo taken at Chili\'s, Route 31, Clay, NY of me with my lovely mother, Ellie, who passed away November 27, 2011 - ten months today. After shopping, we, and my two children ages 12/10, would frequent the Chili\'s Route 31, Clay, NY - our usual booth was always open for us and everyone knew us when we arrived-mom began to slow down but that didn\'t hinder our going and the staff would help us assist her into that  booth-she was determined-we\'d all laugh and always order the chocolate molten lava dessert "four spoons, please"....we want to thank all the wait staff for the their caring and love-while we frequent Chili\'s, we know she remains with us in that booth and in our hearts forever! XO'

b"Dear Chili's,\nOur family will be discontinuing our frequent  visits to your chain effective immediately. This was prompted by the firing of a California Chili's waitress for a Facebook posting about being stiffed on a tip. This young woman was exercizing her constitutional right to free speech. I imagine a lawsuit will be in the offing . It will be well deserved. We call upon you to immediately reinstate this server with a formal apology AND pay for her missed shifts and the tips she would most likely have received. You have a LOT of restaurant competition and when this goes viral you WILL lose business. We personally will do our part as citizens and  will be informing as many friends, family, coworkers as we can to get this story out there. Sincerely, The Archer family "

b"I had the worst service last night at Chili's, and I'm unsure I will return in the future.  My husband and I ordered from the 2 for $20 menu, and I ordered Margarita Grilled Chicken like always, and when I went to cut it up I was shocked to find raw chicken.  I insisted on a new item of the menu, and ordered the Santa Fe Chicken wrap which took 18 minutes to make.  My entire family was done eating at this point when I finally got my food, and I was shocked to learn that it was COLD....It took 18 minutes to make a COLD sandwich? I was NOT happy at all.    I enjoyed my chips and salsa dinner, and nothing else.  This was our favorite dinner joint, but far from favorite now."

b"Love to go to Chilis in Vacaville.. We celebrate pretty much everything there. Today I went at around 12pm with a friend and 3 kids. Lunch was great... Kids where in their best behavior but by the end kids will be kids and they did started to make a noise. I was telling the kids to keep it down when I was interrupted by this male waiter who began to tell us how there is other customers trying to enjoy their meal and that having them be that loud was unacceptable and that if we didn't tell the kids that THEN HE WOULD!!!  After feeling completely shocked, confused and insulted I went and talked to the waiter myself. I told him that I didn't appreciate him going over my table and telling me that, like I wasn't trying already to
Keep the kids quiet. I also reminded him that Chilis IS A FAMILY FRIENDLY restaurant unlike a 4-5 star restaurant, 90% of the people that go to eat there have kids! As a parent you do the best that you can to keep your kids from behaving( which they did
Through out the whole meal) and if people where gonna really be bothered by little kids making little noise that they themselves should probably go to a 4-5 star restaurant with no children allowed. I fail to make you understand that the burst of loudness was no more than it would take you to laugh out loud at a funny joke. Waiter was already close to us when this happened so it's not like we here disturbing other customers. I love my Chilis and the other waitress' apologized profusely for his behavior... I didn't not feel the need to tell a manager since there where nothing wrong with the food just the attitude of one particular server. This would be understandable   if you have kids that are rowdy and maybe running up and down or screaming or jumping in the chairs ( which ive seen plenty)through out the whole meal.  
"

b"Our two year old son, Chase was diagnosed with Leukemia on February 10,2012. He is currently receiving chemotherapy at Doernbecher Children\xe2\x80\x99s Hospital in Portland, Oregon. We are trying to raise monies for his care. All three locations (Main St- Springfield, Coburg Rd & W.11th- Eugene) Papa's Pizza is doing a fundraiser on March 27th,2012. In order to have monies go to his cause, you must print out a flyer http://www.papaspizza.net/fundraisers/03_27_12%20local.pdf . If you are unable to make it to the event, or you live out of town you can always make donations to Northwest Community Credit Union (all locations) on his behalf, or he has a PayPal account that you can make donations with your debit card, his email is chase_starr@hot mail.com. Donations will be accepted before and after the event. Please invite anyone and everyone to make donations, or go to the event. Every little bit helps! Thank you for all your support!

Also, we will have bracelets at Papa's locations for a $5 donation. (please see event page for details of what times they will be available)

More Fundraisers:

BBC Photography (Brittney Brittney Bailey-Chandler) IF YOU DONATE AT MINIMUM $50 TO THIS FUND, I WILL DO A FREE 30 MINUTE PHOTO SHOOT AND INCLUDE ALL ORIGINAL AND DIGITALLY ENHANCED PHOTOS ON A DISC WITH MY COPYRIGHT RELEASE!!! IT'S TAX TIME, SO GIVE A LITTLE! THIS BENEFITS ME IN NO WAY OTHER THAN HELPING MY FRIENDS LITTLE BOY FIGHT THIS AWFUL DISEASE!

Tiffany's Scentsy: Want to help Chase out, and get some Scentsy in the process. For the entire month of March (extended until April 20th)we will be hosting a Scentsy Fundraiser for Chase. It's simple: Take the mini scent testers and catalogs to friends and family and fill orders. After you have gotten as many orders as you can return the testers and completed order forms back to Tiffany 541-606-0011 or Patrice 541-954-2827. 

Aren't in town but you still want to help out, go to www.scentsy.com/harris and click on the open party labeled Chase Starr (25% of all proceeds go to this fund)"

b"We went to Chili's last night (441 in Miami Gardens Florida) and were told there was a 15 minute wait when literally 1/2 the restaurant was empty. When we pointed out the empty tables we got a rude response that those tables were dirty. We should have asked for a manager but we were so upset that we just walked out. I had a similar bad experience at Chili's about 5 years ago and haven't been back until now. Obviously it was a mistake to return to Chili's. I want to share my bad experience with this board. In this era of social media you can't get away with treating people badly without feeling the consequences. "

b'In Novemeber I traveled from Michigan to Puerto Rico to spend my birthday with family! The Chili\'s in Arecibo surprised me by singing "Happy Birthday" in Spanish! I loved it! Thanks so much for the wonderful memory!'
link_name: b"Feliz Cumpleanos from Chili's in Arecibo, Puerto Rico"

status_message: b"I love Chili's, but I am very disappointed with our experience last night.  This is the second time we have gone to Chili's for a 'kids eat free night' and both times, the service was terrible.  The restaurant (both times) seemed to be understaffed...we had to wait 20 minutes for a table (but the place was half empty).  Once seated, we waited almost 10 minutes before a server approached our table.  Our appetizer never arrived, our server was way too busy to check on our table.  A manager never came to the table when we complained about the service, and our check wasn't adjusted to make up for the mistake.   I really think our local Chili's is poorly managed, and it's a shame that once again, what was supposed to be a nice family dinner, ended up with us wondering why we bothered."

We did not eat, had to stop and get something at a fast food place, surely not what I was hungry for!!!!He proceed to give us $5.00 off our next meal, what makes you think I\'ll go back to that place!!!! Seriousl upset!!! '

b"There is really not one particular thing I like about the holidays.. there are several, family of course, the hustle and bustle of shopping, getting your home ready for guests even though you know you don't have enough room you will welcome... a house full, staying up to wee hours of the morning laughing and talking with love ones you haven't seen since last year, putting the kids to bed and telling them they have to go to sleep so Santa will come, driving in the car and just about every radio station has christmas music playing, watching your living room get totally destroyed due to all the wrapping papering, bows and boxes,.... Christmas to me to a whole complete package that lets me know that even though the rest of the year I am just looking forward for payday, this time of year I look toward having the hoildays give another reason to smile and enjoy life."

b'St. Judes is a very worthy cause.The Shriner's Children's Hospitals and St. Judes Children's Research Hospital are both all about the kids.You CAN and SHOULD help support both of these very, very worthy hospitals.The children can't and won't ask for themselves, but my name is G.F. "Hookman" Brown and I can and WILL ask for your help.
Through this effort by Chili's, you can double your dollars to the children at St. Judes and in October you can put a "Buck in the Boot" for the children at the Shriner's Hospitals when you see the men in the vests and funny hats at the major intersections of your hometowns.
Again , this is Hookman Brown asking you to PLEASE, PLEASE help the children.
Remember that if your child or the child of someone you know, ever needs the services these hospitals provide , THESE HOSPITALS WILL BE THERE TO HELP YOU.
Thank You and May God Bless You.'

b'The question is shy did I want to be Hope Captain? The honest answer is, I really never thought about it. My general manager told me to look into it.I did and it took me awhile to decide cause I felt it would put a lot of pressure on me. Then I thought "what are you thinking !?" What an honor it would be to be apart of this. I knew nothing about St.Jude Children\'s Research Hospital till I worked at Chili\'s, and it has been a life changing experience for me. For these yound brave and courageous kids not giving up on the fight for their lives and these amazing doctors donating their spirits alive has to be one of the most beautiful humane things God has shown me. These children are my heroes, and someday I hope to meet them and let them know the impact they\'re making in our lives. So on that note, thank you for giving me this opportunity to make a difference '

b"I am so happy your restaurant supports ST JUDES! They saved my little sisters life! she had leukemia over 20 years ago when survival was slim, in those few years they have such a better survival rate now! Thanks to all who support this Children's Hospital. Your donation truely will save lives! The Cornman Family!"

b"Hello ChiliHeads, My name is Elizabeth Hague and I am one of your Hope Captians.  I am currently in Amarillo TX at store #1351. My favorite time of year is the St. Jude Fundraiser. I asked to be a Hope Captian this year for two very special reasons. The first being that if it were not for St. Jude Childrens' Research Hospital, I may have never met my best friend Ashley; at 7 years of age, Ashley was diagnosed and began treatment for Ovarian Cancer. She is alive and well today at the age of 28. The second reason I love helping St. Jude is that I have been blessed with a healthy child and I feel it is important to support the families of the sick. St. Jude never turns a child away because of the inability to pay and I never want them to have to start because of lack of funding. Please give with your whole hearts this year whether you are making a donation or asking a guest for a donation. Let's make sure everyone gets to meet there future BFF :)"

b"Hey there!! I'm a HOPE Captain in Stuart, FL and the reason I wanted to be one is that  i have a real passion for what St. Judes does... My little brother was diagnosed with a mix of Hodgkins and non-hodgkins when he was only 5 years old, and went through years of chemo, radiation, organ removal and even a self-donated bone marrow transplant. We almost lost him, but St. Judes saved his life and he has just recently passed his 5 year cancer free mark! During the time he was being treated I got to go to Memphis, TN and see all the wonderful things they do up there. They create miracles for the families that are there! So if i can try to help St. Judes in any way possible I'm right there trying my hardest for them!"

b"My name is Ashleigh Pettit.I've been a server at Chili's-Naples, FL #367, for two years. This year I wanted to be more actively involved with the St. Judes fundraiser, and figured what better way to do that than by becoming the Hope Captain for my store. I feel the St. Judes fundraiser is a great way to raise money for the treatment of children battling cancer, and it helps provide money for the research needed to cure cancer. Although I do not yet have any children, I hope to some day, and my heart goes out to the families who are affected by childhood cancers. Last year our restaurant was in the top five for the region, and this year our goal is to be number one. Thank you to everyone who has donated in the past and to the future supporters of the St. Judes fundraiser.Lets all help out and continue to put a smile on these children's faces."

b"I work at the Chili's in Lawrenceville, GA #467. I am sooo excited about being the Hope Captain and I am looking foward to raising lots of money for these kids. No matter how bad we think our lives are sometimes I can not ever imagine being one of these kids or their parents and going through such an awful thing! I will try everything I can to help in any way possible!! You can do more than just help out in september when Chili's has this you can become a partner in hope. I have been one for about 6 years now and I am glad that I am doing what I can to help out someone else. You never know when you will need someone's help."

b'Hi my name is Brandi Nickell and and I work at the North Naples Chilis  Fl Store #1118 on Immokalee Rd. I am excited about being the Hope Captain for my store and really believe in the the help that Saint Judes offers to the children and their families, in their time of need. Saint Judes has help touch so many peoples live and they could not do it with out every ones continued support. So i would like thank everyone who has donated in the past , but lets not  forget that the battle is not over. Every dollars adds to the  fight and  is something we can do as  a community and nation to helps those who live among us  with their fight against cancer; when they felt they had  no place  to turn to.This is for everyone who has had or know someone with Cancer and know the struggle that it causes on ones family. Just remember that everything Saint Judes has done to help those dear to us.'

b"Hi, my name is Daniel and I am the H.O.P.E. Captain for Chili's store #721 Fairmont Parkway in Pasadena TX. I have always been a supporter in St. Jude's children's hospital and raised money for them for the past nine years.

b'Hi!  My name is Mary, and I am proud to be the St. Jude\xe2\x80\x99s Hope
Captain for Chili\xe2\x80\x99s Santana Row.  Ever since learning of Chili\xe2\x80\x99s
association with St. Jude\xe2\x80\x99s Children\xe2\x80\x99s Hospital six years ago, I have
been honored to have the chance to be involved.

The main motivation for wanting to be Hope Captain is that I have
always had a soft spot for children and animals.  On the first Profits
day, my beloved dachshund Boston passed away of cancer, so this is an
emotional time every year.   Additionally, the Chili\xe2\x80\x99s Care Center
brings to mind my deceased father, in that it specializes in the
research and treatment of brain tumors, the affliction that cost him
his life.

I am enthused to undertake this opportunity, and look forward to
making this campaign the best ever.'

b'Bring back the "Shanghai Boneless Wings"....they were the best thing on your menu!!!!!!!!'

b'Been eating at Chili\'s for more years than I\'d care to remember (at least 25) and rarely have I had a bad meal however....Last night we went to one of our local Chili\'s and I see that they no longer have the Chicken Tacos which was always one of my favorite dishes. --delicious tortillias filled with chicken lettuce, tomato and pico..yum.  OK, I\'ll try the "new" Pulled Pork Tacos.  Well, these were four very small greasy tortillias filled with dry, tasteless pork (is this where any left over baby back ribs go?).  They are served on this ridiculious rack and topped with this too tangy barbecue sauce.  Made with Shiner Bock..i\'ll have to take your word for that.  As small as they were and as hungy as I was, I could only eat three of them, that\'s how bad they were.  Now that I realize that it works out the each of the measly tacos cost over $2.00 each.  Epic Fail guys.'

b"My Dad is one of a kind! I know everyone says that but mine truely is. He is such an amazing man. He was crushed back in 2000, breaking his back, sternum, and ribs on each side too many times to count. Luckily by the grace of God he is still able to walk and get around. He is in constanT pain but never lets it show. He... will do anything and everything in his power to do whatever you ask him to, at the drop of a dime. He will stop what he's doing just to help you. Loves his grandbabies, Alex (13), Addison (3), and Amelia(2), they are his world. He LOVES chilis but it's usually too expensive for our whole family to go eat so he rarely gets to enjoy it. My mother and him have been married for almost 36 years and it's amazing to see how much he still loves her. My daddy is my hero and would be a great candidate for this!!!"
b"Why did you remove the New York strip from the menu???? We wan't it back NOW!!!"
b'I love it!!!!!'

b'i serve at airport chilis#1289,jax, florida. in my section 2nite i had the awesome priviledge to serve a beautiful little girl named sydney and her family. chilis is a proud sponsor of st judes childrens research hospital,sydney has been a patient at st judes the past 3 1/2 yrs. sydney is now in recovery. sydney says that she loves playing in the chilis wing, coloring chili peppers on the computers, as well as she loves the multi color changing lites in our wing. made my heart smile. all the push we do every yr asking for donations and coloring peppers makes it worth it for children like sydney! so this yr when "create a pepper" is into full swing, DONATE : )'

b"My dad is the best dad because he's done so much for me and my mom and he always puts us first. A little before I was born my dad was offered a job to work as an artist in Disney (which is like, amazing) and he refused to take it because he wanted to raise me at home :3 While he raised me at home we had a ton of fun together :D He was and still is like my brother! We used to watch Blues Clues together, Play G.I. Joe Adventure Team, I used to draw in his office while he was on the computer, We'd play Star Wars, etc."

b"I think my dad Ernesto Garcia is the best for many reasons:  he has raised three children and taught us right from wrong, supported us in everything we did, and loved us unconditionally.  While I was growing up, I had knee problems and even though he couldn't afford my surgery he still made it happen through making payments.  He has a good heart, loyal, courteous to everyone he comes in contact with.  \nVera  Garcia"

b"My Daddy rocks! He has been a hard worker as long as I can remember (I'm 34)! He had an accident back in '00 that left him on disability for the rest of his life, but he still does what he can! He and my mom have been married going on 36 years. He mows my lawn for me, as I am a single mom (whose ex took the mowe)! He has always been a great daddy ... See Moreto my sister and myself, always giving..anything he can do to help, he will. Even if he has to figure it out along the way! He is a proud Poppy of onegrand son and two granddaughters (13, 3 and 2). He is stuck in the '70's with his long hair and dialect ;) He is a freindly man who has never met a stranger! He loves Chilii's, however it usually costs way too much for all 7 of us to get together. This would make a fantastic day for daddy! He is usually happy with undershirts or undies/socks for any gift giving occasion. Please consider my Daddy!!!"

b"My dad is the best... He wretles with us on saturday mornings, he takes us flying every now and then, he play's video games that he knows we can beat him at, and he owns his own business, while being faithful to my momma. I think my mom and dad could use a night away from 5 kids every now and then..."

b"We really need a good Happy Hour special... like $2 classic Margaritas or a discount on appetizers from 8-10 on certain days. (I'm not sure if Happy Hour depends on the area or not). Guests also really love the 2 for $20... and people REALLY want the Broccoli Cheese soup!"

status_message: b'My mom, is 78 years old and takes 3 great grandchildren to sports games and practice.  She has been treasurer of firemens auxiliary for over 40 years and is very involved.  There is nothing she would not do for her family and friends.  My mom is the rock of the family, and deserves all the love we give her.'

b'i love my mom  she has done sooo much for me and my siblings since i was little but especailly in the last year.  i spend 5 months last summer out of work due to a shattered ankle and broken leg (3 bones in numnerous place) and they said my other ankle mihgt as well have been broken too. when i broke it i was rushing out the door to go to my older sisters college graduation for the weekend. needless to say mom missed it due to staying with me in the hopital. dad on crutches himself for something wtih his knee still went to the graduation to make everyone happy!! but my mom and father took care of me that whole time and now here i am again laid up becuase i had two more surgies on that leg, i have noooo idea how i would have been able to go through this if it were not for them!! nevermind everything else they do day in and day out!!! i could NOT EVER ask for better caring loving parents!!!!'

b'Listen up! If you want the BEST Margarita in the world, have your bartender make one of the new Freshest and one of the new Pomegranate ones and mix them together. If you ask nice, they might put them in a shaker for you and pour it in 2 glasses. b"The ever-changing menu is killin' me. I have been a fan of Chili's for 2 years, and was a full-fledged Chilihead from the late 80's - early 90's (Tyler... store #23, right?). I love and will always be loyal to Chili's, but it just doesn't feeli like Chii's anymore. Everyone I talk to says the same thing. There are still some great choices on the menu (Mushroom jack fajitas, anyone?!) but bring back the SAND, the ROJO burger, the PRIDE, the MONTY, the original SUPERS and CH SUPERS, the CH TACOS and the FRISCO salad! Back in the day, there was always a wait at every Chili's you went to... now I can go at any time and it's wide open. Make Chili's Chili's again, please! Thank you! :)"

Most recent steak sandwich order seemed like a serious downgrade in meat, rather chewy...sinuey. May have been a nice idea for some employee w/ a particular taste and caught on, but need to bring back the cheesesteak!!"
